title: Academic research: build reference database for SLR - Upwork
description: Currently working on two SLR papers within the CS field (related to product management, startups, requirements engineering); one that requires revision and one that I'm going to get started based on the comments of the feedback. Which means to one needs to be done faster than the other. Overall it's building two lists of references (see excel attached). 1st paper: Create a list of all the references that you find for the following search queries: ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "strategic" AND "management" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "product" AND "strategy" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "product" AND "planning" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "development" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "marketing" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "sales" OR "fulfillment" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( ("Delivery" AND “services) OR "support" ) ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( "requirements" AND “engineering" ) in each of the following databases: SpringerLink https://link.springer.com/ Wiley InterScience http://www3.interscience.wiley.com ACM Digital Library http://portal.acm.org IEEE Xplore https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/home.jsp ScienceDirect http://www.sciencedirect.com/ ISI Web of knowledge (http://www.isiknowledge.com. Scopus https://www.scopus.com/search/form.uri?display=basic#basic No limitation on year, only journals and conferences, and written in English. This list should be the base for that SLR. For each of the found references, you fill a row in the excel file. For each reference Fill out the following columns: A: N/A (just to keep track of all the references B: N/A (for me to fill out after having imported the Endnote file) C: Endnote file: Endnote reference file of the paper, including in the name the id (provided by you in the name of the file) D: the query you've used to find him E: Source (database) : name of the DB you've found the reference F: title: title of the paper G: year of publication :: add the year of publication H: citations :: add the number of citations that the paper has I: references :: add the number of references the paper has in their reference list J: double :: Y when there's a double reference, found in another DB; N when it's unique across the full list K id of retained :: when J is Y, add there the id of the one reference that's still being retained for analysis L has PDF :: Try to also have a pdf file of the actual paper that I can then add to the endnote file for analysis, if no PDF: N M ID PDF :: The actual PDF file with in the name this ID so that I can find it back for analysis In the end, this list will have to be double checked against a list of 134 papers I've already have; making sure that they are in both sets, or which ones need to be added accordingly. 2nd paper: The same as above, but for the following search query (same reference databases and excel (of course a separate excel, or at least tab)). Look for ( "product manager" OR "product management" ) AND ( startup OR "start up" OR "start-up" ) No limitation on year, only journals and conferences, and written in English. Skills: List Building, Research Papers, Microsoft Excel, EndNote

This means you can only connect a single SD or microSD card to your computer one at a time to one USB or USB-C port on your computer to read to or write data from it. title: Admin Locked Out of Application - Upwork
description: Here is the issue my client has posed: ============================ Nick, We have a customer with a custom web application that I wanted to see if you may be able to help. The web app is stored on a AWS server (we do have full access to it). The customer use to access it via this IP:  https://34.220.243.124 However at some point last year… for some reason the IP address changed to this - http://34.232.186.171/logIn However…. The user\password they have has not worked since the IP address has changed. Want to see if you can help troubleshoot? The app developer is no longer around – it was before us, but a very messy court case from what I understand. ============================== Here is my initial response: Matt, I dug around a bit and I do see that the application login with the new IP is functional, or at the very least, present. The forgot password is the obvious, but if the email address is no longer valid then that would be a useless endeavor. The good news is that you have access to the server, files, and databases. I am more familiar with the WordPress environment and so I have had to go into a database and inject my own username and password. I don't know exactly what  that would look like for your customers' issue, but the process should be fairly similar. Creating an administrative login directly in the application involves modifying the application's database or its config files. This is where it gets fuzzy for me as I am not familiar with the applications architecture, its database schema or what programming language is being used in the app. So the process is going to vary significantly. With that in mind, here is a general approach. First, you need to familiarize yourself with the application's file structure so that you can find where the config files are located. You need to understand the authentication logic, and where the database connection settings are located. For databased in WP which uses PHP, I look for config.php but it might be something like .env, database.php, settings.py, (for Django) config.rb (for Ruby on Rails), config.json, or config.js, database.js (for Node.js Applications), or appsettings.json (for ASP.NET Core Apps). Next, you will want to identify the database that stores the access credentials. When you find the configuration file that houses the database connection settings take note of the database type, the host, the port, the database name, and ultimately the username and password. From here you will want to use the credentials you find to connect to the database using a DB management tool or command-line interface, something like phpMyAdmin for MySQL, pgAdmin for PostgreSQL, or MongoDB Compass for MongoDB. Once you are connected to the database you will need to locate the table where the user account information is stored. It should be named something like 'users', ' accounts', or 'admin_users', something like that. Make note of the structure of the table, especially the columns that have the usernames, password hashes, roles, or permissions. Then you will want to insert a new record into the user table with administrative privileges. If the passwords are stored as hashes (which they should be if the security is good), you'll need to generate a hash of the password you wish to use. There are a ton of tools and libraries for this online. Generating a password hash will require some understanding of the hashing algorithm being used by the app (ex. bcrypt, SHA-256, etc...). Finally, Test the new login. Hopefully you will have administrative access! I did a quick search for an example of the SQL query. If the application uses an SQL database it might look something like this: INSERT INTO users (username, password, role) VALUES ('newadmin', 'hashedpassword', 'admin'); Replace 'hashedpassword' with the actual has of your password and adjust the table and column names as per the apps schema. Of course, you will want to be sure to back up your database before making changes just in case you need to restore. I hope this information is helpful. I have done it a time or two before, but it was for WordPress website. title: Exa Livestreaming Platform - Upwork
description: Livestreaming Platform: - Similar to Tiktok live, Twitch, and Kick - The vertical screen will be comprised of 30% video cam, 40% content, and 30% chat Programming Languages: - Golang through microservices - C/C++? Twitch's architecture that we got the main points from, we are not completely sure about some or all of these they are twitch's way of handling their livestreaming. We are open to your way if you have a better one. Video system: - Video ingest —  take RTMP video in, and then transport it to the transcode system - Transcode system — take the incoming RTMP stream from the broadcaster, and transcode it into multiple HLS streams. This is implemented via a combination of C/C++, and Go - Distribution and Edge — Distribute the HLS streams to geographically disparate points of presences, such that you have the highest quality video streaming experience. Again, mostly written in Go - No viewcount Chat: - Edge — Receives and distribute messages between clients and backend services. Edge speaks the IRC protocol over both raw TCP and WebSockets - Pubsub — Distributes messages internally across Edge nodes. Pubsub and Edge combine to form a hierarchical message distribution system which executes massive fanout - Room — Responsible for the viewer list. Room aggregates, stores, and queries membership data across all our edges to retrieve viewer lists for each channel’s chat room. - Allow viewers to @anyone in the viewer list - Email for account creation - Chat will be have its own portion on the entire bottom Web APIs and Data: - Web APIs that allow users to manage and customize their profiles - Search and Discovery services that help you to find the streams that you want Web and Client Applications: - Focus on mobile first native apps for the major mobile and tablet platforms (iOS and Android, vertical mode like TikTok live), then the desktop application with horizontal mode - Automatically turn on mobile notifications for viewers after downloading the app - Send mobile notification for changing stream title - ai chat bot occasionally typing pick up lines or comments or emojis as a regular viewer to keep the chat entertained - Slideshow feature to switch between livestream spotlights Data Science Infrastructure - Streaming aggregators to summarize watchtime metrics in near real-time for broadcasters - Badges based on watch time - No saving data of messages, clips, but maybe save livestream VODs to reuse? Milestones: 1. Able to show content and chat 1.5. Connect to streaming software like OBS Studio 2. Account creation and can type in chat 3. Download in the app store. need apple enterprise account after LLC is formed. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKmwUip8iew 4. MVP done able to go live and watchSkills: Golang, Amazon Web Services, Twitch, Mobile App, Chat & Messaging Software, Search Engine, Web API, Websockets

Here is a video of what is going on: https://app.screencast.com/hhA20NYDYnmwN Feedback from support as follows: Cloudways: "We would like to inform you that we have sent test emails via third-party tools and from server side and it seems to be working fine. Here, you may check the test email” WP Core is fine. Fluent (WP Manage Ninjas): Thanks for the video to explain the issue. We have tested the login details email and it is sent from Fluent SMTP, please check the screenshot. The email contains a URL to reset the password:  https://prnt.sc/Fnf6X0GKSfsh It seems like the plugin you are using to register the contact is not sending the emails or there is a problem while generating the problem while sending this mail. If you are using Fluent CRM automation to create the user, you can check whether you have disabled the welcome user email as shown in the screenshot. If this is the case, you can re-enable this and your problem will be resolved. However, if you are using another plugin, you may check that plugin's settings. LearnDash: Couldn’t find anything, and recommended I use their registration form. This of course doesn’t fix the problem. Thrivecart: No idea, call Learndash.  Skills: WordPress Bug Fix, WordPress Development, PHP

title: Full-Stack Web Developer, Stripe Expert (Secure Stripe Integration Specialist) - Upwork
description: We are looking for a highly skilled Full-Stack Web Developer with specialized expertise in secure Stripe API integration for our WordPress website. The candidate will develop a custom, secure checkout process that discreetly processes payments, without exposing Stripe as our payment processor. This role demands robust front-end and back-end development skills, an eye for secure and user-friendly web design, and deep knowledge of payment gateway integrations. A key part of this role will involve creating a simple, non-technical method for the business owner to update or change Stripe API keys without PHP knowledge. Priority Objective: • Discreet Payment Processing: A critical priority for this role is the development and implementation of a payment system that processes transactions seamlessly without revealing the use of Stripe as the payment processor to end users or through any part of the user interface. The successful candidate will employ innovative solutions and best practices to ensure the payment integration is effectively invisible, safeguarding the identity of our payment processing system from public and technical scrutiny. Responsibilities: • Custom Checkout Page Development: Design and implement a custom checkout page that aligns with our branding and user experience goals, ensuring the process does not mention Stripe. • Secure Stripe API Integration: Integrate Stripe’s payment processing capabilities into our website via advanced server-side coding, ensuring all API communications are securely handled server-side and invisible to end-users. • Simplified API Key Management: Develop an easy-to-use interface or system that allows non-technical personnel (e.g., business owner) to update or change Stripe API keys without needing to understand PHP or access server files directly. This could involve a secure admin panel within WordPress or a secure, standalone script. • Secure Data Handling: Implement secure handling of sensitive payment information, ensuring PCI DSS compliance, utilizing customized Stripe Elements for secure input fields. • Performance Optimization and Security: Ensure the checkout process is optimized for performance, employing SSL/TLS for data transmission, and adhering to secure coding practices to protect user data. • Comprehensive Documentation and Training: Provide detailed documentation and training materials on managing and updating Stripe API keys through the developed interface or system. Requirements: • Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer with a strong portfolio in e-commerce, secure payment gateway integrations, specifically Stripe. • Proficient in PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, with a strong understanding of WordPress development including themes, plugins, and custom functionality. • Demonstrated knowledge of web security practices, PCI compliance, and data protection related to payment processing. • Experience in creating user-friendly admin interfaces or tools for non-technical users. • Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently. • Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with non-technical team members. Nice to Have: • Experience with frontend frameworks (e.g., React,Vue.js) for creating dynamic user interfaces. • Knowledge of additional payment gateways and e-commerce platforms. Application Instructions: • Please submit your application and a portfolio of relevant projects. Highlight your experience with Stripe integrations, custom checkout processes. • State your availability and provide an estimated timeline for the completion of this project. • Please start your application with the sentence "I have read and understand the job requirements." This ensures that you have carefully considered all aspects of the role and helps us quickly identify serious candidates. Confidentiality Commitment: By applying for and accepting this position, you acknowledge and agree to adhere to the highest standards of confidentiality regarding all aspects of your work and any information disclosed to you or accessed by you during the project. This encompasses, but is not limited to, proprietary technologies, operational practices, customer information, and details about our products and services. Your acceptance of the job is considered a binding commitment to maintain the confidentiality of all proprietary information during your engagement and after its conclusion. Thanks!Skills: Full-Stack Development, Ecommerce Website, Stripe, API, PHP, API Integration, WordPress, Payment Gateway Integration, Web Development

title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience – DR158 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: Web Application, AI Agent Development, AI App Development, AI Development, AI Model Integration, API Development, Database Development, Full-Stack Development, Payment Gateway Integration, Website Optimization, Web Development, Platform Plugin, Desktop Application, Browser Extension, Ecommerce Website

title: Improve Authorize.net Processing Performance - Upwork
description: Our SaaS application (.NET 6+) uses authorize.net as our payment gateway. We use the accept.js authorize.net widget. We use four APIs on account creation: 1. The first API is to verify if the user profile already exists in authorize.net. 2. If the profile exists, we proceed to delete the existing profile. 3. Following this, we create a user subscription with a new customer profile, including credit card details. 4. Finally, we attempt to charge the customer profile. It runs slowly to the point where we've implemented a 45 second time out delay to wait for a response from authorize.net. The issue arises between the last two APIs. Upon sending a request to create the ARB (Automated Recurring Billing) subscription with a new profile, it typically takes 2 to 3 seconds for a response. However, when proceeding to charge the transaction, we encounter inconsistencies. Sometimes, the profile is confirmed to be available within 2 seconds, while at other times, it takes longer than 10 seconds. Subsequently, after sending the request for the transaction, we encounter the error message stating that the profile does not exist. We're looking for someone with expertise in improving processing time of authorize.net transactions from the checkout cart to approval to review our configuration. The right person will provide examples of where they've improved authorize.net processing performance before.Skills: Authorize.Net

Here is the example: https://www.egnahemsbolaget.se/projekt/selmagard/ Objectives We seek a skilled MAXScript developer to create a script (or series of scripts) that accomplishes the following: Camera View Analysis: Determine which parts of apartment mesh layers are visible from each camera position in 3ds Max. 2D Projection: Accurately project the visible 3D mesh parts onto a 2D plane corresponding to the camera’s view for integration into our web service. Data Export: Export the visibility data and 2D projections in a web-friendly format for use in our apartment-picker interface. Key Tasks 1. Visibility Check Script: Develop a MAXScript that iterates through specified cameras, analyzing which apartment meshes are visible from each viewpoint. This analysis should account for the camera’s frustum and any occlusions by other building elements. 2. 2D Projection Logic: Implement logic within the script to project visible portions of the apartment meshes onto a 2D plane. This step is crucial for identifying the exact areas in the 2D rendered image where each apartment is located. 3. Data Handling: The script must exclude non-visible mesh parts, considering the 3D model’s orientation and the limitations of a 2D environment. It should then export the visibility and projection data in a structured format (preferably JSON), including apartment identifiers, camera names, and the corresponding 2D coordinates or regions on the image where the apartment is visible. You can view the attachment to see what type of co-ordinates we need to input into our exising app.Skills: Scripting, Python, JavaScript, Autodesk 3ds Max

title: Godot 3D CAD Model Review Application Development - Upwork
description: ### Project Overview This project aims to develop a 3D CAD model viewer and editor using Godot 4 as the primary development environment. The application will provide users with the ability to import, view, interact with, and annotate 3D CAD models directly within the application. This document outlines the specifications for the application's development, including the required features, functionality, and user interactions. ### Development Specifications #### Core Features An existing Godot app that can load and display 3D CAD models will be provided so that it can be expanded with the following features. 1. **Clipping Planes:**    - Users must be able to generate a clipping plane that intersects the 3D model.    - The clipping plane should be alignable to a model surface as specified by the user.    - The intersection should result in a visual cut through the model, allowing the user to inspect the internal structures.    - The user is able to manipulate the clipping plane by translating and rotating. 2. **Measurement Tool:**    - A feature to measure the distance between two points on the model is required.    - The result should display the distance and project this distance onto the major axes (X, Y, Z) for easy reference. 3. **Tagging and Metadata:**    - Users should be able to tag different parts of the mesh and add metadata to these tags.    - The application must support adding markup comments. These comments should be displayed in a bubble with an arrow pointing to the tagged location.    - Users should have the option to display or hide the comments. 4. **Saving and Loading:**    - The application must allow saving the current state, including the imported 3D CAD model, clipping plane data, and any markup comments/metadata, into a single file and in a specific file format.    - Other users must be able to open and load these files using the same application to view the CAD models and associated metadata as saved by the original user. #### Technical Requirements - **Development Environment:** Godot 4. - **Language:** GDScript or C# (depending on the developer's expertise and the project requirements). - **External Libraries:** Use of external libraries or plugins for CAD file parsing and manipulation must be clearly documented and comply with their respective licenses. #### User Interface - The application should have a clean, intuitive interface that makes it easy for users to import models, create clipping planes, measure distances, and add tags or comments. - A toolbar or menu system should provide quick access to the main features. - Visual cues or tooltips should be used to guide the user through the application's functionality. #### Documentation and Testing - Include a developer guide with details on the project structure, external libraries used, and extension points for future development. - The application must be thoroughly tested on Windows. #### Deliverables 1. Source code with detailed comments and adherence to coding standards. #### Timeline and Milestones - The project timeline and specific milestones will be determined in consultation with the developer based on their estimate of the effort required for each feature.Skills: C#, Godot, CAD, Shading Language, Windows App Development

title: AWS server infrastructure management, highly experienced professional, 5h/week, fully remote - Upwork
description: Join UpViral, a leader in referral marketing software solutions since 2015, on our quest to build a disruptive marketing AI to automate the entire marketing process. Our Marketing AI will change their world by setting up and running their entire marketing for them. The main requirements of this position are: - AWS Cloud Services Expertise: Proficiency in AWS Cloud services (CloudFront, EC2, RDS for MySQL), database administration (MongoDB, MySQL), and skills in performance tuning, scalability, high availability, and cost management of AWS resources. - Dedicated Focus on Security: Strong understanding of network and code security principles, best practices in securing servers and databases, managing firewalls, and responding to security incidents effectively. - Operational Excellence and Automation: Experience in environment management (staging, production), proficiency in automation and scripting (Python, Bash), and skills in monitoring, backup, and disaster recovery processes. Required skills and expertise: - AWS Cloud Services Expertise: Proficiency in AWS services, particularly those used in your infrastructure, such as AWS CloudFront, EC2, RDS for MySQL, and other relevant AWS services. - Firewall Management: Skills in managing and configuring firewalls, both at the application level (like AWS WAF with CloudFront) and network level. - Database Administration: Knowledge in managing MongoDB and MySQL databases, including setting up auto-scaling, backups, and understanding of Atlas (for MongoDB) and AWS backup solutions. - Network Security: Understanding of network security principles and experience in maintaining a secure network, especially in a cloud environment. This includes configuring network access controls and understanding private networking in AWS. - Security Best Practices: Knowledge of best practices for securing servers and databases, including regular security updates and patches. - Code Security: Understanding of secure coding practices, particularly for input validation and sanitization to prevent SQL injections and other types of attacks. - Backup and Recovery: Proficiency in managing backup strategies and disaster recovery processes, including knowledge of retention policies and the ability to restore data when necessary. - Monitoring and Incident Response: Skills in monitoring infrastructure for security threats and performance issues, and responding effectively to any incidents. - Automation and Scripting: Ability to use automation tools and write scripts (e.g., using Python, Bash) to streamline various operational tasks including updates and scaling. - Environment Management: Experience in managing separate environments (like staging and production) and ensuring proper isolation between these environments. - Performance Tuning: Skills in optimizing the performance of cloud resources, particularly for handling high traffic loads. - Scalability and High Availability: Knowledge in implementing and managing scalable, highly available infrastructure. - Cost Management: Ability to optimize and manage costs related to AWS services. - Software Development Infrastructure Management: Proficiency in setting up and maintaining the infrastructure required for the entire software development lifecycle, from development to production. Expertise in designing, setting up, and managing Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines Our fully remote team is working together from many different time zones between Europe and India. We love to challenge the status quo and work together with a supportive team spirit. - 5-10 hours per week, part-time - Location: 100% remote - Your time zone has to be between GMT+0 and GMT+8 - Salary that fits you expertise and skillsSkills: Cloud Management, Amazon Web Services, DevOps, Network Security, Amazon EC2

title: Development Requirement for Enterprise Application Using LangChain and OpenAI API - Upwork
description: We are seeking a skilled developer or development team to create an innovative enterprise application leveraging the capabilities of LangChain and the OpenAI API. Our goal is to develop a solution that dynamically generates solution documents based on pre-set prompts, effectively combining templates from previous solutions with new customer requirements to produce tailored solution outlines and detailed textual explanations. Project Overview: The core functionality of this application will involve: Integrating LangChain with the OpenAI API to utilize advanced natural language processing and generation capabilities. Designing a system that can interpret pre-set prompts related to specific customer needs and industry standards. Generating comprehensive solution documents that include both an outline and detailed descriptions, based on the amalgamation of existing solution templates and new customer inputs.Ensuring the application supports various document formats for output, including but not limited to PDF and DOCX. Key Features: Prompt-Based Solution Generation: The application should use LangChain to process and understand pre-set prompts, then leverage the OpenAI API to generate text that forms the basis of solution documents. Template Integration: Ability to integrate and adapt existing solution templates into the generation process, ensuring that the output is not only relevant and customized but also consistent with our company's standards and previous solutions. Customization and Flexibility: Features that allow users to specify unique requirements or preferences that the system will consider when generating solution documents. LangServe Deployment: The application should be deployed using LangServe, taking advantage of its built-in features such as parallelization, fallbacks, batch processing, streaming, and asynchronous support for API endpoints. This will ensure efficient and scalable application performance. Requirements: Proven experience with LangChain and OpenAI API, including familiarity with their integration and application deployment using LangServe. Strong background in natural language processing and document generation. Ability to work closely with our team to understand and implement specific requirements related to our industry and customer needs. Commitment to delivering a high-quality, user-friendly application within the agreed timeline. Deliverables: A fully functional enterprise application that meets the described features and requirements. Documentation detailing the application architecture, codebase, and usage instructions. A training session for our team on managing and operating the application. We are excited about the potential of this application to streamline our solution development process and offer highly customized documents to meet our clients' needs. We look forward to your proposal, including your approach to this project, estimated timeline, and budget.Skills: LangChain, Python, API

title: Python developer to rewrite script for comparing CSV files and Inserting / Updating to Postgres DB - Upwork
description: Hi, Looking for an expert python developer to optimize a script I have which compares data form database with a CSV file. Multiple calls to DB can be CPU extensive and slow. Right now, the script works like this: 1- fetch data from db for the provided host (column) 2- read data form csv 3- compare data in csv with data from db 4- do actions ( insert, delete, change logging, sales logging and others) What I think we should instead do: Have 2 CSV files: Old.csv and New.csv Compare both CSV files , and then make the changes to DB based on discovered differences. I need an expert python developer to rewrite the code and propose a better solution for scaling ( in case I have hundreds of the same script working on the machine ). The script is actually being ran like this: Python3 script.py --read csvfile --host https://example.com What i think will be ideal: Python3 script.py --read csvfile --old oldcsv --host https://example.com Then from there, compare and make the changes in batch to the db at the end of the script run. I'm open to more propositions. This might be a good future collaboration as I have regular work. When reaching out, do mention "IREAD". No agencies / bots please. The task should be done as soon as possible. Looking forward. Thanks.Skills: Python, PostgreSQL, Database

Dedicated Prior Day OHLC for RTH values only, with a built in POC value derived from the Order Flow Volume Profile logic. 2.)  Conversion of Several C++ logic from a different trade software, into NinjaTrader 8. Each one is a separate Job. (3+ indicators) 3.) Logic developed to be injected into a strategy to manage risk based off of specific Win/Loss Parameters. This includes logic that would look at the account start of each day, (not just the logics wins/losses) calculating if it is currently in a trade across the account, if it is not then if it takes a trade and wins gives the sum of the win to be referenced later. If it losses, it takes the sum of the loss and notes the quantity of "losses". If a trade is executed after the win, it will only allow a trade to fire off if the sum of the previous trade divided by 2 is within the risk parameters at the current lot size. if it is not, no allowance of execution is permitted. If a trade is taken after the loss, and wins, repeat the first step of calculating the sum, if it is now positive continue with the logic, if it is still negative prohibit execution of entries. 4.)Develop supplemental logic to be injected into a strategy that would "count" the occurrences of a set up at designated areas on either side of an edge (individually) "Long/Short" opportunities. If it is the first/second time at that edge on a "short" set up, allow execution of signal. Vice versa for the "long" set up as well. If it is beyond 3 times at the edge for a short set up, it no longer should allow the signal to be thrown out. same for the long side. Note there are several areas/edges. Not just one. 5.) More to come.... Skills: Forex Trading, MetaTrader 4, MetaTrader 5, NinjaTrader, Trading Automation, MQL 4, C#, C++, Derivatives Trading, Financial Trading, MQL 5, .NET Framework, Online Financial Trading, Product Development, Bot Development

I’m looking for someone passionate about real estate and looking for an opportunity to showcase their skills! **Responsibilities:** 1. **CRM Management:**    - Maintain and organize client information using CHIME CRM.    - Ensure accurate and up-to-date records of all client interactions. 2. **Marketing and Communication:**    - Create a weekly newsletter to keep clients informed about market trends and opportunities.    - Manage and execute social media posts to enhance online presence. 3. **Transaction Coordination:**    - Prepare and review offers and purchase agreements.    - Order preliminary reports, inspection reports, and Home Warranty Policies as required.    - Gather pertinent HOA information if applicable. 4. **MLS Management:**    - Input and edit property details within the Multiple Listing Service (MLS).    - Ensure listings are current and reflective of property status. 5. **Calendar and Scheduling:**    - Maintain a comprehensive calendar/schedule for important dates, appointments, and transaction duties.    - Schedule appointments for inspections, appraisals, and other vendor services. 6. **Task Monitoring and Update:**    - Stay ahead of deadlines, regularly checking and updating the status of important tasks.    - Provide timely updates to the real estate team and clients. 7. **Comfortable Cold Calling** **Qualifications:** - Prior experience in real estate wholesaling and residential real estate is a must - Transaction coordinator experience is essential. - Proficient in CHIME CRM. - Familiarity with MLS operations and data input/editing. - Strong organizational skills with attention to detail. - Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. - Noise cancellation microphone is a must. **Compensation:** - Salary: $6 - $10 to begin. Pay is negotiable upon skill set. Also, opportunities for bonus per deal closed! **How to Apply:** If you're ready to bring your passion to our team, please submit your resume, along with an audio and video recording, and a cover letter. Please use personalized recording.  In the subject line & video, mention "I'm your match for Pure Passion." You are welcome to include your social media profiles for consideration as well. I would love to build an ongoing relationship as we grow! There is potential to grow in this role and also management PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE PRIOR REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDER YOURSELF AN EXPERT! Thank you so much for considering our team! Best wishes! Skills: Data Entry, Administrative Support, Communications, Email Communication, Call Scheduling, Executive Support, Virtual Assistance

title: Real Estate Listing Transaction Coordinator - Upwork
description: Real Estate Transaction Coordinator Job Summary Chicago-based real estate office seeking a driven Transaction Coordinator to manage contracts throughout the entire home selling and buying process. You'll be responsible for managing transactions from start to finish in order to ensure smooth and successful sales. The ideal candidate is extremely organized and has superb customer service skills to ensure our clients feel at ease. If you love working with people and thrive in a fast-paced work environment, apply today! VIRTUAL TC ROLE: The role of the Transaction Coordinator (Contract to Close) is to oversee all aspects of buyer and seller transactions from executed purchase agreement to closing. The Transaction Coordinator will be responsible for making sure that these tasks are completed with efficiency, and accuracy within a timely manner. RESPONSIBILITIES: Assist in listing data entry when the listing coordinator is not available. This includes preparing agreements for listing appointments by entering contact and property information from our CRM database, and drafting property listings in the realtor's website (MRED). Manage every stage of a transaction (contract to close). Regularly update and maintain communication with clients, agents, attorneys, and lenders. Regularly update key team members on all property transaction updates. Ensure all required documentation has been correctly completed and submitted to the required systems for file compliance. Coordinate & schedule Open Houses Assist the Operations Manager with miscellaneous projects. REQUIREMENTS: Must have experience working as a real estate transaction coordinator for at least six months. Must be able to work between the hours of 12:00PM to 5:00PM (US Central time zone), or later if necessary on Monday - Friday with occasional urgent tasks on the weekend with potential to full-time. Must be able to write and speak in English fluently with the ability to communicate clearly. Preferred to have a basic understanding of Illinois Real Estate. Must have a basic understanding of real estate terminology. Must be willing to conduct business via video conference. Must have the ability to make sound and quick decisions when oversight is not available. Must be detail-oriented. Knowledge of the following real estate systems is preferred, but not required (Chime, MRED, Follow-Up Boss, Skyslope). Must be able to conduct yourself in a professional manner despite stressful situations. REAL ESTATE TRANSACTION COORDINATION QUALIFICATIONS: High school diploma or GED required, preferably some college experience. Previous experience in real estate management and transaction coordination. Must have excellent organization and communication skills. Dedicated to providing excellent customer service and creating a great customer experience. Must be a team player with a desire to learn. COMPENSATION AND ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: An hourly wage of up to $9 & paid time off (PTO) after probation period. The transaction manager must work exclusively for  The Sohail Real Estate Group during working hours. The agreement will be immediately terminated if any work is conducted outside the team.Skills: Email Communication, Real Estate, Data Entry, Administrative Support, Time Management

title: Build a Learning Experience Platform - Upwork
description: About us We are a creative learning agency. Aligned with our mission to change the way people think about learning, we want to shape their learning experience and make an impact that would support their growth in the workplace and overall life. We have been able to support some great companies in building their eLearning courses. To scale and move away from creating a course only for one company, we want to provide learning support to many companies through on-demand courses and a customizable content delivery platform. In phases, we are developing a content delivery platform to house our courses and learning programs for our customers. Our goal is to provide end-to-end support to small businesses, startups, authors, coaches, leadership development firms, professional associations, and non-profits. About the Role We are looking for a Full Stack Developer with strong development skills and some experience developing a learning platform. You will be responsible for writing code from scratch, utilizing the front-end designs and code from Figma, reviewing code with our CTO, and maintaining the code. You will report directly to Founder/ CEO and work with the CTO as well. Our goal is to build an MVP of the learning experience platform and allow beta testers to try it as we build out the other features within the year. Required Skills/Abilities: Experience with Javascript/ Typescript, Angular, HTML, CSS, React, and PHP for front end. Experience with Phyton and/or Node.js Experience with any source control systems like GitHub Experience developing a learning platform Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL Experience using Google Cloud or AWS Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing Strong listening skills, attention to detail, and decision-making skills Demonstrate advanced proficiency in written and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment Adapt quickly and easily to changing requirements and needs Work independently as well as collaboratively Proficient in Google Suite and project management tools. Education and Experience: Four (4) or more years of experience as a full stack developer with experience with front end and backend stack. Good knowledge of software development practices and principles (Clean code, refactoring, agile, etc) Experience with building software in small chucks Experience using Figma for frontend design Experience using GitHub to store and versioning the code Good communication and usage of Slack Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience Must have a portfolio of work or case studies to talk through or a sample project or activity would be required. Skills: PostgreSQL, Google Cloud Platform, React, Web Application, Software Debugging, Full-Stack Development, Python, Learning Management System, JavaScript, AWS Cloud9

The ideal candidate should have a strong background in building complex, scalable software systems. We are not looking for candidates who have only worked on website or CMS development. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain advanced SaaS product using Django. Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand and transform business requirements into scalable solutions. Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, ensuring top-quality output. Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability. Provide technical leadership and mentor junior team members. Ensure security and privacy compliance in all aspects of development. Qualifications: 5+ years of professional experience in Django development. Deep knowledge of Django ORM and a good understanding of database architecture principles. Strong proficiency in developing REST APIs. Solid experience in writing unit and integration tests. Familiarity with front-end technologies like JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3. Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills. Proven track record of working in a SaaS product company, demonstrating an ability to handle complex logic and data structures. Experience with cloud services and database technologies. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and a commitment to writing clean, maintainable, Good to Have: Experience with multi-tenancy. Experience with server side technologies like Celery, Elasticsearch, Redis, Docker, and AWS services (RDS, EC2, S3, Route53, Cloudfront). What We Offer: An opportunity to work on challenging projects with a dynamic and talented team. A culture that values innovative thinking and passionate individuals. Remote first mindset Equity and Stock Options in a bootstrapped, profitable startup Annual trips to meet the team in fun locations around the world. ________________________________________ Probationary Period: The initial period of one month will be probationary, during which we will assess the candidate's fitment for the role. Depending on the circumstances, we may require the candidate to start working via Upwork for the first 1-2 months. Hiring Process: Our standard hiring process is designed to ensure a comprehensive evaluation of each candidate's skills and potential fit with our team. It includes the following stages: Online Aptitude Test: Approximately 1 hour, assessing problem-solving and technical skills. Code Assignment: Candidates will be given a coding task that typically requires around 2 days to complete. We offer up to 1 week for completion to accommodate different schedules. Interview with the CTO: A technical interview to discuss the candidate's technical expertise, experience, and the code assignment. Interview with the CEO: A final interview to assess cultural fit and alignment with our company's values and goals. Candidates will be evaluated at each stage to ensure they meet the high standards required for the role. Ready to Code the Extraordinary? Join Proven.Skills: Django, Python, Celery, React

title: Implementing an automated payment and invoicing system via Stripe to manage deposits  - Upwork
description: As the president of Le Couvent Val-Morin, a retreat center in Quebec, Canada, I'm seeking to enhance our operational efficiency and client experience through Stripe's payment solutions. Our facility, with a 40-bed capacity, is available for exclusive rental to groups for special events. To secure these rentals, we implement a tiered deposit schedule: 50% of the payment is required at the time of booking, followed by 25% three months prior to arrival, and the remaining 25% one month before arrival. The final invoice is issued on the day of departure. I am interested in configuring Stripe to automatically process these three payments on the specified dates using a client’s credit card information. title: Pre Sales Solution Architect - Upwork
description:
# AI Virtual Casting Assistant: Transforming inclusivity through AWS technology
**Project Aim:** Develop an AI-powered virtual casting assistant to address the film and TV industry's lack of inclusivity and potential for unconscious bias.
**Proposed Use Cases:**
* **Talent Discovery:** Leverage **Amazon Rekognition** for facial analysis and emotion recognition to identify diverse actors based on physical characteristics and emotional range relevant to roles.
* **Bias Mitigation:** Utilize **Amazon SageMaker** to build and train machine learning models on objective criteria (experience, skills) and diverse actor datasets, reducing subjective bias in initial screening.
* **Streamlined Process:** Automate scheduling, initial video auditions, and basic feedback analysis through **Amazon Transcribe** and **Amazon Comprehend**, freeing casting directors for nuanced evaluations.
**AWS Services of Interest:**
* **Amazon Rekognition:** Facial analysis for physical characteristic matching (e.g., ethnicity, age), emotion recognition for assessing emotional range.
* **Amazon SageMaker:** Building and training custom machine learning models for unbiased talent selection based on diverse datasets.
* **Amazon Transcribe:** Converting video audition audio to text for automated transcription and basic analysis.
* **Amazon Comprehend:** Sentiment analysis of transcribed text to provide basic feedback on audition delivery.
* **Amazon EC2 or Amazon ECS:** Scalable computing resources for building, training, and deploying the AI model.
* **Amazon S3:** Secure storage for audition video and data assets.
**Usage Estimations:**
* Projected daily user base: 100 casting directors, 500 actors
* Estimated daily video auditions: 200
* Anticipated data storage needs: 10 TB per year
**Partnership Value:**
Customer seeks to collaborate with AWS to gain access to cutting-edge AI services, technical expertise, and scalability to:
* **Accelerate development:** Leverage AWS's infrastructure and pre-built services to fast-track prototype creation and deployment.
* **Optimize performance:** Fine-tune AI models and ensure efficient resource utilization through AWS expertise.
* **Scale seamlessly:** Expand the assistant's capabilities and user base as the project gains traction.
By partnering with AWS, customer’s AI virtual casting assistant can create a positive impact on the film and TV industry, fostering inclusivity and enriching storytelling through diverse talent discovery.

We need to reconstruct the system which processes these files to fill a MongoDB database. We also want to integrate this "license" management with a more broad "user" management, to comprehend other information outside the study platform and to build a sort of CRM. We already designed the entities for the new database in JSON. We need a professional developer to discuss and eventually improve the design, then build the database, set the right indexes and optimization and, finally, write a script to daily read the files we receive to fill the new database. You'll interface with our ICT manager and after the first meeting, needed to let you understand our intent, we could also provide a recap of the meaning of the structure and of the possible values of the various fields. We already have the MongoDB installed and we can provide you with permissions.Skills: Database Architecture, Database Design, Database Development, MongoDB, Database, Software Architecture & Design

title: Fullstack Developer needed for Data-Focused NextJS Website - Upwork
description: I am looking to have a data-centric website developed. More information will be provided upon acceptance of the contract. However this is the tech stack: Technology Stack: - AppWrite (primarily user authentication) - MongoDB - PostgreSQL - NGINX & Ubuntu (as the web server) Code Implementation: - Utilizing NextJS for Server-Side Rendering (SSR) preferably TypeScript but JavaScript is fine Payment Processing: - Integration with Paddle.com UI/UX: Charts - Echarts UI - Shadcn Newsletter Management: - Ghost.org Documentation: - Utilizing markdoc.dev This is not your typical website; it's a project of considerable complexity due to it being a data-focused website. I have a VERY rough sketch of the website, but the developer who takes on this project will need an entrepreneurial mindset to read the Miro Mindmap and then develop the features. I want to make this very clear, the mindmap (Miro.com) will be the primary source of direction. While I will provide rough sketches on Figma, screenshots, and similar/competitor websites for ideas, the miro mindmap should be considered the core guidance, with everything else supplemental. I have thorough github issues listing the features and what they entail, as well as github discussions to explain functionality, but you will need the abilty to understand the feature, then design it, and then implement the code. While UI/UX design isn't the primary focus, the ability to develop a website without wireframes or Figma designs is crucial. Candidates with UX design skills will be prioritized, as it eliminates the need for a separate UX designer later on. The pay will reflect the added skillset. The website will need to be viewed on mobile and desktop. The website primarily focuses on data representation, featuring numerous tables and charts. User authentication is managed through a self-hosted installation of AppWrite (that you will setup on the server provided), with data sourced dynamically from MongoDB and PostgreSQL for charts and tables using AppWrite Functions. Therefore, comfort with data manipulation and display is essential. Data collection is automated through scripts, leaving the primary task of the developer to focus on data presentation from the databases. The website will be employing many/all strategies to prevent scraping. You will also need to be familiar with anti-scraping techniques, and server-side-rendering. I don't want people to be able to 'inspect elements' and then be able to extract data. This contract pertains to the initial version of the website, with opportunities for future engagements involving feature enhancements, maintenance, and more. Due to the project's complexity, we expect inquiries to demonstrate a thorough understanding of the requirements outlined herein. We prioritize candidates who can comprehend the full scope of the project and its intricacies. Your proposal should thoroughly understand the scope of this project, and show it. Answering one word answers to questions, or using ChatGPT will not suffice. Final Deliverables: 1. Code repository uploaded to GitHub (provided post-contract acceptance) 2. Design & implementation of code on the server (credentials provided post-contract acceptance) 3. Website launch and thorough testing to ensure seamless functionality.Skills: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, ChatGPT, Web Application, NGINX, TypeScript, JavaScript, Web Development, CSS, UX & UI

title: Senior ASIC physical design Engineer ( Analog/Digital/Mixed+ Memory Layout/char )  - Upwork
description: Job Posting: Position: Senior Chip Design Engineer We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Chip Design Engineer with over 10 years of expertise in chip design, particularly with up-to-date knowledge in Synopsys and TSMC. The ideal candidate should be proficient in undertaking various tasks across the Test Chip Development, Test Chip Physical Design, and Chip Implementation CAD . **Test Chip Development :** 1. Execute FE implementation and related flow development, encompassing system-level design, RTL coding, verification, DFT, MBIST, and synthesis. 2. Develop architecture and methodologies for "design-for-test (DFT)" and "design-for-diagnosis" for yield learning purposes. 3. Devise architecture and methodologies for silicon correlation. **Test Chip Physical Design :** 1. Oversee BE implementation and related flow development, covering chip-level planning, PG network design, floorplan, place, CTS, route, power analysis (PDNA sign-off), and physical verification. 2. Develop design methodologies and CAD utilities for BE implementation, especially addressing challenges arising from new technologies, and provide customer support utilities. 3. Conduct technology benchmarking to comprehend PPA of emerging technologies. **Chip Implementation CAD:** 1. Lead flow development for RC extraction, timing analysis, and timing fixing. 2. Spearhead CAD platform development for design stage integration, design kits management, and design DB management. 3. Drive CAD/EDA development to address various design issues. **Required Practical Experience:** - Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer, and below. - Knowledge of physical design layout parasitic effects in analog circuits. - Layout techniques to meet ESD, latch-up, antenna requirements. - Experience with verification tools such as ICV, Calibre. - Experience with Design tool(s): Custom Compiler, Cadence Virtuoso, or equivalent. - Experience in scripting languages: TCL, etc. (optional). **Job Description:** - Chip/Block level floorplan. - Clock tree synthesis. - Place & Route. - RC extraction. - STA, timing closure. - IR/EM analysis and fix. - DRC/LVS/ERC analysis and fix. - Tape-out sign-off. - APR Flow development. **Qualifications:** Key Qualifications: - BSEE or MSEE with a minimum of 5 years of experience in digital design. - Familiarity with Verilog and VCS. Good knowledge of back-end synthesis tools DC/PT is desirable. - Scripting experience in Shell, Perl, Python, and TCL is a plus. - Good theoretical and practical knowledge of digital signal processing and data recovery circuits is desirable. - Strong communication skills for interacting between different design groups and customer support teams are required. - Self-motivated, proactive, and able to apply good design quality while meeting tight deadlines. - Resolves issues in inventive ways and exercises sound judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. - BCH degree and above in EE/CS. - Experienced in digital design/design flow/APR chip implementation-related field. - Experienced in advanced process nodes (28nm and below). - Familiarity with Script languages (shell, python, TCL) or C/C++. - Familiar with APR tools (such as Cadence Innovus and Synopsys IC Compiler II) & PPA analysis/boost methodology. - Good customer-oriented attitude and communication skills. - Proficiency in English is a plus. - Highly welcome candidates who have less experience but possess good related design experience, working attitude, and self-motivation.Skills: Electronic Design, Circuit Design, Embedded System, Eagle, Nanotechnology

title: android application with Bluetooth and GPS that receives measurements and writes them to a file - Upwork
description: I need a simple android application with Bluetooth and GPS that receives measurements and writes them to a file. Application should use Jetpack compose. UI should be built in kotlin, rest of the app should be written in java. On launch the app must list available BT devices and connect to a selected one. It should offer to select the baud rate for serial communication with default of 9600bps. It should prompt the user on where to store the file on the device. On successful connection application should send configuration string: GET_CFG Example response: CH=4,D0=35, D1=40,D2=55,D3=60 CH value tells you how many channels are there on the BT, D0..Dn are current config options for each channel. Unless responding to a config change the device will send measurements at a rate of about 5 times per second. Number of values will be the same as the number of channels. Example message: VALUES: 1500,1600,1660,1700 Application must display measurements on the tiles, one per tile, two tiles per row. Each tile has a value range of 100 to 20000. When a user taps on a tile they can adjust 3 values: min, max and D. The min is always less than max by at least 10. When the tile's value becomes less than min or larger than max it gradually changes color from white to red to show how much it goes beyond threshold. The value of D is an integer number in the range of 1..1000. When the user changes value of D the application must send command over bluetooth SET_CFG Dn=35 Where n is channel number. Every time new values are received the app should save timestamp, gps position and values received as comma separated values. Application should have a dropdown which allows users to select different speeds using AT command. AT+BAUDx: Replace x with a value from 1 to 9. Each value corresponds to a specific baud rate setting. For example: To set the baud rate to 9600, use AT+BAUD4.Skills: Android, Java, Android App Development, Kotlin

title: GitLab auto-devops chart and CRD to deploy Redis via OT Redis Operator - Upwork

(we can run fork of the chart of ENV settings) Operator: https://github.com/ot-container-kit/redis-operator/releases Gitlabs chart: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cluster-integration/auto-deploy-image/ Main repo/image: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cluster-integration/auto-deploy-image/ CRD: ``` apiVersion: redis.redis.opstreelabs.in/v1beta2 kind: Redis metadata:   name: redis-standalone spec:   kubernetesConfig:     image: quay.io/opstree/redis:v7.0.12     imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent   storage:     volumeClaimTemplate:       spec:         accessModes: ["ReadWriteOnce"]         resources:           requests:             storage: 1Gi   podSecurityContext:     runAsUser: 1000     fsGroup: 1000 ``` Error: ``` Error from server (Forbidden): error when retrieving current configuration of: Resource: "redis.redis.opstreelabs.in/v1beta2, Resource=redis", GroupVersionKind: "redis.redis.opstreelabs.in/v1beta2, Kind=Redis" Name: "redis-standalone", Namespace: "hello-go-348-review-redis-oper-owwsxh" from server for: ".k8s/redis.yaml": redis.redis.redis.opstreelabs.in "redis-standalone" is forbidden: User "hello-go-348-review-redis-oper-owwsxh-service-account" cannot get resource "redis" in API group "redis.redis.opstreelabs.in" in the namespace "hello-go-348-review-redis-oper-owwsxh" ``` I can install Redis manually via helm or/and fork gitlab's repo to add Redis as helm dependency, but the  goal is that it's all automated, since we create new namespaces multiple times a day.Skills: Kubernetes, DevOps, GitLab

title: Deploy and Customize OpenDAX - Upwork
description: Set up a digital asset exchange with OpenDAX, configuring wallets, deposits, purchasing of digital assets, and customizing for Digital Assets with Escrow (DAE): Setting Up OpenDAX 1. Environment Setup:    - Install prerequisites: Docker, Docker Compose, Ruby, Rails.    - Clone the OpenDAX repository from GitHub. 2. Exchange Configuration:    - Update `config/app.yml` with exchange details.    - Set currencies, markets, and trading pairs in `config/seed/currencies.yml`, `config/seed/markets.yml`, and `config/seed/trading_pairs.yml`. 3. Database Setup:    - Initialize the database and load seed data.    - Configure settings in `config/database.yml`. 4. Wallet Integration:    - Set up wallet services for supported cryptocurrencies.    - Configure wallet settings in `config/seed/wallets.yml`. 5. User Interface Customization:    - Modify front-end components for branding and design.    - Use React components and CSS for customization. 6. Exchange Deployment:    - Use Docker Compose to deploy services.    - Test functionality and ensure all services are running correctly. 7. Security Implementation:    - Set up SSL certificates and two-factor authentication (2FA).    - Regularly update software for security patches. 8. Launch and Monitoring:    - Open exchange to the public and onboard users.    - Monitor performance, security, and user activity. Configuring Wallets and Trading 1. User Registration and Wallet Creation:    - Users sign up and automatically get a wallet for each supported cryptocurrency. 2. Depositing Money:    - Integrate a payment gateway for fiat currency deposits.    - (Note: Cryptocurrency deposits are not supported in this setup.) 3. Purchasing Digital Assets:    - Users place buy orders for digital assets.    - The matching engine executes trades, and assets are transferred to the user's wallet. Customizing for Digital Assets with Escrow (DAE) 1. Define DAE as a Tradable Asset:    - Add DAE as an asset in `config/seed/currencies.yml`.    - Create a market pairing DAE with USD in `config/seed/markets.yml`. 2. Modify the Trading Interface:    - Customize the UI to accommodate DAE trading.    - Implement order placement for DAE. 3. Implement Escrow Mechanism:    - Modify the matching logic to move funds to an escrow account for DAE orders.    - Develop a mechanism for escrow release once the DAE is confirmed as released. Considerations - Ensure robust security measures are in place, especially for escrow transactions. - Thoroughly test the modified trading engine and escrow mechanism.Skills: Docker, Ruby, React

title: Need help connecting Unity to OpenCV - Upwork
description: Introduction: The following is the initial brief for the help being sought in script writing for a Unity Project.   Product Background: The overall product is called “The Controller” and has been a series of art installations I’ve been doing over the years with previous versions using Midi Controllers, the Leap Motion Controller, a Real Sense 3d Camera, and a Tobii Eye Tracker to control the VFX.  Final end product can be best described as a “Eye Candy Toy” or “Hippy Trap” rather than a game.  As such, the requested work is intended to unblock me (the animator / artist) so I can set up the environment to work in.    Project Description: In this version (Controller Version 5) I want to switch over to using OpenCV and so I’m exploring what data I can get from the OpenCV system and which devices I can build to. Im not yet sure if the final version will be on an IPAD or a computer connected to a monitor and a web cam.  My current tests have only been with a web cam but if possible to make this iOS friendly it gives me more options for later. My dev environment is usually on a silicon Mac.  I do have a PC if needed but one reason to switch from Tobii Eye tracker to OpenCV is so I can use my newer computer while working on this project and so I can reduce the cost per unit when I install it (it is risky leaving a full computer at a art festival or bar where this thing usually gets seen). Core Requirements: - Unity Project works on apple silicon - We can pass some variables from OpenCV to Unity’s VFX graph - - Positional Data from the 20 points in OpenCV’s hand model - - Positional Data from Open CV’s Head Model (head box location, eye locations, nose location, mouth location) - - Emotion Data from OpenCVs emotion detector (Happy, Sad, Angry) Additional Goals: - Unity project can eventually build to iOS - Current LTS version of Unity (2023.3.9f1) About the starting unity project files (provided by client). Clean Initial install using URP: Dropbox/_Controller Project fiverr/ControlerV5_URP_OpenCV_02.zip Installed OpenCV for Unity - https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/integration/opencv-for-unity-21088 Note:  I am also including a version of the same thing but with HDRP as it is easier to see a a texture in the HDRP version.  Im hoping we can have just a URP version tho. Project Goals - they all revolve around passing values from OpenCV to VFXGraph: Further Details on Core Tasks: You can put in any default VFX graph to pass variables to.  I will then add my VFX into that new graph. I want to get point data from the hand detector: - Can we pass values seen in dnn: HandPoseEstimationMediaPipeline?  This one makes a model of any hand broken down into 21 points.  See here: https://developers.google.com/mediapipe/solutions/vision/hand_landmarker .   My goal would be to both have the X and Y position of the points available in the VFX graph but also to then make inferences about their positions so I can set force effect directions.  For example. Based on positions of points 7 and 8 I can tell which way a hand is pointing and make the particles from the vfx graph be effected by a force in the same direction . I want to get point and location data from the head detector: - Can we pass the head box location, and 5 face points seen in this demo to the VFX graph?  Seen in FaceDetectionYuNetV2Example in this project and documented here: https://developers.google.com/mediapipe/solutions/vision/face_detector - Can we pass values seen in dnn: facial expression recognition example?  Specifically send: face expression (happiness, anger, neutral, a variable in VFXGraph).  See here for more in: https://learnopencv.com/facial-emotion-recognition/ Additional Details - In URP will we be able to see the bitmap data passed from the webcam to a layer in the VFX graph?  Current URP isn’t passing bitmap data in the test scene HandPoseEstiamteMediaPipeline in the URP version of this project.  But if you open the HDRP version you can see it does.  I would like it if I can also use the bitmapped data from the live camera in the VFX graph, so I am worried that if I don’t get the bitmapped data straight from the OpenCV processed source I won’t be able to get it from Skills: C#, OpenCV, Unity, iOS

title: Computer Scientist with experience in 3D registration needed to optimize human teeth meshes - Upwork
description: 𝗟𝗼𝗼𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮𝗻 𝗘𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝘂𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝗦𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝟯𝗗 𝗥𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: We are on the hunt for a highly skilled 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝘂𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁 or 𝟯𝗗 𝗔𝗿𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁 with deep expertise in 𝟯𝗗 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, optimization, and modeling. Our project involves advanced techniques in registering scanned mesh data with high-precision ground truth (𝗚𝗧) meshes. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in computational geometry, and experience with state of the art 3D registration implementations. 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀:     Analyze and process 𝗚𝗧 meshes and scanned mesh data to align locally.     Develop and implement optimization algorithms to refine the pose and alignment of 𝟯𝗗 objects in a scene.     Collaborate with our team to integrate registration algorithms into our existing pipeline.     Design a metric to describe how well a scanned and 𝗚𝗧 mesh coincide. 𝗥𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀:     Advanced degree in 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝘂𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲, 𝟯𝗗 𝗔𝗻𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, or a related field.     Proven experience with 𝟯𝗗 registration and optimization techniques.     Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.     Strong programming skills in 𝗣𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗻, 𝗖, and bash scripting a plus.     Previous experience computing 3D pointclouds through depth and pose is a plus.      𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗗𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘀:     In essence, we need 𝘆𝗼𝘂 to use a GT mesh of a human mouth in the past, and a low-quality mesh of the same human mouth in the present, to arrive at a near-GT mesh of the mouth in the present.     We already have the teeth separated from the gum, and have a global registration of the 2 meshes.     We need you to find the pose transformation 𝐏ⱼ that moves each GT tooth 𝐣 from its starting pose to the best aligned pose on the scanned mesh.     Example images of both meshes are attached.     We have 16 meshes, and we were thinking on 150 $/mesh, but are open to negotiating.     Skills: 3D Design, 3D Modeling, 3D Animation, 3D Computer Graphics File Format, Computer Animation, CAD & CAM Software, Computer Vision

title: Notion re-architecture + Automation - Upwork
description: Izun is a blockchain fund focused on investing in blockchain startups, establishing its own ventures, and developing products based on DeFi and institutional products bridging Web2 and Web3 technologies. Current Drawbacks and Issues with Notion Structuration: Lack of Customization: The existing structure within Notion does not fully align with Izun's specific needs and workflows, resulting in inefficiencies and information fragmentation. Manual Data Entry: Duplication of data across different pages and workspaces, leading to redundancy and increased workload for employees. Limited Automation: Absence of automated processes between Notion and external tools such as Telegram, Gmail, Google Calendar, and Calendly, hindering seamless workflow integration. Inconsistent Data Management: Discrepancies in data representation and management between the public and private workspaces, affecting data integrity and accessibility. Proposed State Architecture with Automation: Public Izun Workspace: Izun DNA: A dedicated space for showcasing company pitch, core values, and other essential information for public consumption. Operating System: Business Directory: Redesigned to reflect data from the private business directory, ensuring consistency while withholding sensitive details. Creation of separate directories for Web3 companies and talents. Blockchain R&D: A centralized space for research and development activities related to projects, protocols, and product creation within the blockchain domain. Team Meeting Notes: Regularly updated notes from team meetings for transparency and collaboration. Private Izun Workspace (Limited Access): Project Management: Consolidation of all tasks from various departments, including HR and Legal, into a unified board for efficient project tracking and management. HR: Integration of recruitment pipeline with potential impacts on Legal and Business Directory pages. Structured candidate profiles with meeting notes and progress tracking. Legal: Centralized management of all legal-related work, including contract templates and legal opinions specific to the crypto space. Streamlined contract creation and signing processes. Business Directory: Full directory management originating from HR or direct entry creation, ensuring comprehensive employee and company profiles. Team Meeting Notes: Confidential notes from internal team meetings for reference and decision-making. Blockchain Conferences: Integration with events management, linking conference interactions with candidate and company profiles for contextual understanding. Automation Integration: Telegram: Explore options for integrating Telegram for real-time communication and notifications within Notion. Gmail & Google Calendar: Investigate automation possibilities for syncing emails and calendar events with relevant Notion pages for streamlined information management. Calendly: Implement Calendly integration to automate scheduling tasks and seamlessly update associated Notion records. Additional Considerations: Scalability: Ensure the proposed architecture and automation solutions are scalable to accommodate future growth and evolving business requirements. Security: Implement appropriate security measures to safeguard sensitive data, especially in the private workspace accessible to limited employees.
