title: Angular Code Refactoring - Upwork
description: Current App Structure I currently have a CRM app that is built using Angular 16, NGRX, Firebase and Angular Material. The app currenly allows salesmen to manage their customers and orders. It is already deployed in production on firebase hosting, and is already being used by a few internal salesmen. Front End - Front End Built using Angular 16. - All UI is built using Angular Material. - Angular Reactive Forms are used to handle forms. - For now, the app is only responsive for desktop. - We have a generic-table component that is used to display data in a table format, it is built using Angular Material Table. State Management - State Management using NGRX, following the Redux Pattern. - NGRX Entity Adapter is used based on the models defined. - State is transferred to container components, that use async pipes and transfer data to presentational components. - We current have 3 main features: `auth`, `customers` and `orders`. - auth: handles the user authentication. - customers: handles the customers data. - orders: handles the orders data related to salesmen. - Each feature has its own state, actions, reducers, selectors and effects. Many selectors are used to pass data to container components. - Actions are used to trigger state changes. - Effects are used to handle side effects, such as loading data. Backend - Backend is 100% based on firebase Firestore. - Angular Fire is used to handle the connection to Firestore. - The interaction with the backend is done through services, that are called from side effects. RXJS is used to handle the data flow. - All data models are defined in a shared folder, that is used by the front end and the backend. Authentication - Authentication is done using Firebase Authentication. - Each salesman is automatically assigned to a user with a backend Cloud Function, and that user receives a salesmanId that is passed to the user token. The Project We need an Expert Angular Developer that has experience with Angular, NGRX and Firebase to perform the tasks below. - Refactor the current app with best practices and clean code, regarding Angular, NGRX, RXJS, Firebase and all other technologies used. - Update Angular, NGRX, RXJS and all other technologies used to the latest version. - While refactoring, the developer will create unit tests using Jasmine and Karma, and e2e tests using Cypress, with the goal of achieving 100% test coverage. - The developer will also create a CI/CD pipeline, that will run the tests and deploy the app to Firebase Hosting. - Refactor the generic-table component so that it can be used to display the data in the way we expect, we want to use this same component on all the features to display tabular data. - It is expected that after the refactoring, the app will be bug free and will have a better performance. - We expect this project to take 1 month to be completed. - The developer must sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) to ensure the confidentiality of the project. The purpose of this code refactoring is to make the code more maintainable, scalable and readable. We want to make sure that the code is following best practices and that it is easy to understand and maintain in the future. Long term goals - We intend to add many other features to the CRM on the near future, not only for internal salesmen, but also for managers, administrators, and external salesmen that would need to access on mobile devices. - We also intend to use this same stack to develop many other apps for internal company use, on other domains, such as Transportation, Stock Management, Financial Management, etc, for internal use and for clients. - All of these apps will be used for our company, but we have plans to sell them as SAAS products in the future. - We want to hire an Expert Developer with extensive experience with the stack we are using, that is willing to work with us on the long term on many other projects.Skills: Angular Material, RxJS, Jasmine, Angular, Firebase, Cypress

The platforms are Readymode, GHL, Ring Central, Fireflies.Ai, Google Sheets, & Plecto. I am looking to integrate the Readymode dialer platform to GoHighLevel to auto transfer details from contact information on the data to the contacts in GHL. This needs to be done when an call is marked in Readymode as Set Appointment- when this happens it will go into a Round Robin Style Calendar in GHL with the First Name, Last Name, Email, Phone number, address, city, state, zip code,  utility bill amount readily available to be seen in the new contact created and appointment set in GHL. In GHL I need a full project management pipeline with various stages of deal progression as our solar projects progress from sold deal to install. I want to drag and drop these manually as they move along through the natural progression. It would be nice to send out automated texts and emails to the number and email listed for each contact as they are moved from one stage to the next to keep the customer in the loop. If the appointment is marked as a no show they will go to a drip campaign to nurture the lead via text and email. They will also receive an immediate link to reschedule another appointment on our calendar. When an appointment sits with our sales team we need a link with Appypie to connect the call recordings done via Ring Central to store the call recording attached to the contact made in GHL. This will be used with Fireflies.Ai to automatically transcribe the call to voice to text and easily review calls to coach reps and see insight into what occured during the interaction. After a appointment is closed or demo'd and not sold  we want to automatically send out a customer satisfaction survey to the contact number & email on file to assess sales persons performance. It will need to be integrated with a google sheet automatically to update with call results as well. (Not mandatory) As the project moves forward on the project management pipeline from booked appointment to other stages it will automatically need to be updating our leaderboard in Plecto to provide real time insight into what is happening for our team. There will be two leaderboards one for appointment setters and one for closers. I will attach examples of how this should appear that I have made as a mock up in photoshop for your reference. title: Camunda Scalability & AWS Optimization - Upwork
description: Our company is currently utilizing AWS as our infrastructure and Camunda as our automation tool. However, we've been encountering an issue lately. This has caused significant problems in our automation process, which could negatively impact our operations. As we have many users, our usage is also high, and we're looking to optimize Camunda and AWS to handle more consumption. To do this, we are planning to focus on two main tasks. The first task is to upgrade Camunda to version 8, which will provide us with the latest features and better performance. The second task is to add more servers to handle the load. Currently, we have 9 BPMN diagrams running, resulting in almost 17,000 processes. This cannot be handled by one database and one server, which is why we need to have multiple servers to handle the load. We understand the importance of automation in our business processes, and we want to ensure that our systems can handle the expected load without any issues. title: Total Addressable Market Analysis for Immersive Video Cameras - Upwork
description: I need an analysis on the Total Addressable Market for immersive cameras. Companies like ARRI, RED, Sony, and Cannon are all starting to make immersive cameras that can capture content in 180 and 270 degrees in formats such as Apple Immersive Videos which is a 180-degree 3D 8K recording format captured with Spatial Audio. I need the best estimate for what the Total Addressable Market is for this category. Ideally, the research would arrive at a ballpark set of figures projected for the next 1-5 years. This estimate would be the total volume (sales dollars or unit qty) of Cameras that capture Spatial/Immersive Video in ~2025 (one year) and beyond up to 2030 potentially; this would be across Professional market and Consumer market (consumer market would be things like GoPro, professional market would be things like ARRI). Also I need a breakdown of specific forecasts for individual camera manufacturers (like ARRI, RED, Sony, Cannon, and others). This would be a volume (sales dollars or unit qty) of their specific camera offering that capture Spatial/Immersive Video in ~2025-2030 across Professional and Consumer. Here is a possible framework to use in doing this research: Calculating the Total Addressable Market (TAM) for companies that produce immersive video cameras, such as ARRI, involves understanding the scope of the market these companies are targeting. The TAM represents the overall revenue opportunity available for a product or service if 100% market share were achieved. For immersive video cameras, which are often used in filmmaking, broadcasting, virtual reality (VR) productions, and increasingly in sectors like education, corporate training, and real estate, this requires a multi-faceted approach. However, specific dollar figures require current market data, trends, and access to comprehensive market research reports, which can vary year by year. As of my last update in April 2023, here's a framework to understand how you might approach determining the TAM for immersive video camera producers: Identify the Key Markets: Film and Television Production: This includes major film studios, independent filmmakers, and television production companies. Commercial and Advertising: Businesses creating commercials and branded content. Live Events and Sports Broadcasting: Companies that specialize in capturing live events, concerts, and sports. Education and Training: Organizations using immersive video for educational purposes or to train employees. Real Estate and Architecture: Firms leveraging immersive video to offer virtual tours or visualize architectural projects. VR Content Creation: Entities focused on creating content specifically for VR platforms. Market Research and Reports: Look for industry reports related to each of these sectors, focusing on the adoption and investment in immersive video technologies. These reports often provide market size, growth projections, and insights into consumer and business demand. Industry Growth Factors: Consider how trends like the growth of virtual and augmented reality, the increasing demand for high-quality video content across digital platforms, and technological advancements in camera technology might expand the market. Geographical Considerations: The TAM should reflect global opportunities, taking into account regional variations in market adoption and investment in technology. Historical Sales Data and Future Projections: Analyze historical sales data of immersive video cameras and related equipment. Combine this with industry growth rates to forecast future sales. To give a rough example, if research suggests that the global film and video market is projected to grow to $X billion by a certain year, and immersive video technology is estimated to capture Y% of that market, you could calculate a potential TAM for immersive video cameras in that segment. Repeat this process across the other identified sectors and sum them up for a comprehensive TAM. Remember, the accuracy of your TAM calculation depends on the reliability of your data sources and the assumptions you make regarding market penetration and growth. Given the rapidly evolving nature of technology and media consumption habits, these factors can change, necessitating regular updates to your market analysis. Skills: Market Research

The incumbent will act in accordance with our core values: Be Empathetic, Be Disruptive, Be Agile, Be Open, Be Kind. Be Responsible, and Be Better Than Yesterday. Job Description: The Inventory and Demand Planner is responsible for overseeing and optimizing inventory levels across the supply chain to ensure efficient operations and meet customer demands. This role involves monitoring inventory levels, forecasting demand, and developing strategies to minimize stockouts, excess inventory, and associated costs. The Inventory and Demand Planner collaborates with various departments, including procurement, sales, and production, to ensure accurate demand planning and inventory replenishment. Responsibilities: Demand Forecasting: Utilize historical data, market trends, and sales inputs to forecast product demand accurately. Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to gather insights and adjust forecasts accordingly. Inventory Optimization: Analyze inventory levels, turnover rates, and lead times to optimize stock levels. Determine appropriate safety stock levels and reorder points to minimize stockouts while avoiding excessive inventory. Supply Planning: Collaborate with product teams to ensure timely replenishment of inventory. Coordinate with suppliers to manage lead times, quantities, and delivery schedules. Inventory Monitoring: Regularly monitor inventory levels and identify potential risks or opportunities. Conduct regular inventory audits to ensure accuracy and reconcile any discrepancies. Reporting and Analysis: Generate reports and provide insights on inventory performance, including key metrics such as stock turnover, fill rates, and service levels. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate inventory management processes and recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce costs. Implement best practices and adopt new tools or technologies to streamline inventory management. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, production, and logistics, to align inventory plans with business goals. Communicate inventory status, forecasts, and potential issues to stakeholders. Risk Management: Identify potential risks related to inventory management, such as supply chain disruptions, market fluctuations, or product obsolescence. Develop contingency plans and strategies to mitigate risks and ensure continuity of supply. Requirements: - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English with Chinese as a strong preference. - Proven experience in inventory management, demand forecasting, or supply chain planning. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proficiency in data analysis and inventory planning tools. - Solid understanding of supply chain principles, inventory control techniques, and demand planning methodologies. - Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and external suppliers. - Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. - Proficiency in using inventory management software and advanced Excel skills. - Knowledge of ERP systems and inventory management modules is desirable. - Familiarity with industry regulations and best practices in inventory management. - Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data managementSkills: Inventory Management, Microsoft Excel, Logistics Management, Business Analysis, Order Management

Sales Forecast Dashboard: This dashboard provides forecasts based on current pipeline data and historical trends. title: Oat milk base product development  - Upwork
description: The product we are looking to create  is an oat milk base, we are looking for a syrupy texture. Why oat milk?  Oat milk is set to grow exponentially over the next few years due to a few obvious reasons, i.e rise of lactose intolerant people, sustainability concerns and animal welfare awareness. This is especially true for the UK as the forecast for oat milk is +40% growth over the next 5 years. With that said, oat milk in the shape we currently know is not the best at the moment. Firstly, because people currently buy oat milks that are actually made from 90%+ water for a crazy price of around GBP 2.50 to 3 per litre. Each bottle of milk usually has only 2-3% of oat, making the drink very liquid, tasteless and again incredibly expensive for water. Secondly, most people only use a dash of milk in their coffee/tea, but the shelf life of these bottles is very short leading to product waste. Also, buying many bottles is a lot of packaging that ultimately ends up in our household waste. Why an oat milk base? With all the above in mind, our idea is to bring a new way of consuming oat milk. With our oat milk base, people will actually be able to buy what they should pay for. Our base will be made from 90%+ of oat and be low in oil with a minimum of adding water. This base will allow people to dose their milk and adapt it to their taste depending on how much water they want to add per spoon, making their milk stronger in taste or lighter depending on what they want. Additionally, this base is versatile, again depending on the water they add they should be able  to create oat creams and make their favourite savoury dish or cakes. The other USP is the shelf life, this base will have a long shelf like (app 1 year), drastically limiting waste of the product but also waste of packaging since one pot of our base will be equal to 7 liters of oat milk (so here we are also reducing packaging waste by 7 times). Of course, we know that coffee shops are important in our culture, and this base will be barista ready, allowing coffee shops to use and to froth their oat milk to perfection. Finally, it goes without saying that our product will be as natural and as local as possible, using the best ingredients we can find across Europe and providing customers with a high quality product mindful of the people, planet and animal.Skills: Science, Scientific Writing, Food & Beverage, Food, Research & Development, Food Engineering, Content Writing, Product Development

title: Green chemist, electronic diodes, thinking @ materials chemistry engineer  bandgap thick film - Upwork
description: In this interesting project, you will suggest several chemicals and several methods to make green diodes. You are a creative chemist, or materials science technician, or a component electronics engineer, or equivalent background. In order to begin qualifying for this project, please answer 3 of these 5 easy questions : Queston 1 :      x.022 × 10²³   What is the numeric value of X? Question 2 : EP_   What is the missing alphabetical character? Question 3 : Which of these is different from the other 3 :  ionic, vanderwaals, metallic, covalent Question 4: P.I.N. Component.  What does the initial I stand for? Question 5 : eV?  What is the full name of eV? In this creative project, you will look at about 100 common chemicals, and you will try to work up a composite of these chemicals, and appropriate production techniques, which would allow us to prototype green electronic COMPOSITE diodes, albeit low performance diodes. Here are the suggested benchmarks and payment amounts : Total amount for all milestones : USD$105.00      Total time duration for all milestones : 19 days. MILESTONE 1, Budget $25.00, Duration 5 days : In milestone 1, you will identify the materials in the list which have semiconductive properties. You will also identify materials in the list which can dope the materials to make the materials semiconductors.  You will identify them as P type or N type.   You will suggest methods to cause the materials to be doped, e.g. laser doping, xenon flash doping, solution doping, core@shell, etc.  Some dopants may make the chemicals simply conductive, while other chemicals alter the bandgap of the semiconductive chemicals. The lists contain about 100 green chemicals.  Here are some of the chemicals in the lists.: Semiconductors : zinc oxide, zinc iron oxide, attapulgite, bentonite sodium, ferric oxide, graphite, kaolin, magnesium oxide, magnesium sulfate, mica, montmorillonite, SiO2 Dopants : alum, carbon, chlorophyll, nitrogen, zinc, salt, potassium chloride, sodium sulfate, carbonized sorbitol Linkers or glues : sorbitol, animal glue, cmc, ‘Trisodium citrate dihydrate’’ , chitosan Surfactants : lecithin etc. Hole Transport :  ZnO and others can be doped to become Hole Transport. MILESTONE 2, Budget $20.00, Duration 5 days : We want a simple composite diode.  The composition needs to be durable enough for use as an ingredient for a coating on consumer products.   We need linkers which will bond the materials together.  Sorbitol is a pretty good glue to bind zinc oxide to carbon.   Or we need simple chemical process to bind the materials together.   For example, with carbonization process, carbon will adhere to zinc oxide.   Or complimentary zeta potentials can “adhere”  a first + zeta particle to a second – zeta particle. MILESTONE 3 Budget $15.00, Duration 4 days : We are printers, and we like particles, pigments, flakes, lamellar shapes, that we can easily disperse into water or ethyl lactate or other green solvent to make a printed coating. We also like photocopying processes to deposit flakes. Please indicate likely semiconductive, and doped semiconductive materials that are inherently flakes, lamellar flake shapes.  Please also indicate semiconductie materials which can be formed into flake shapes, using simple processes like ball milling, exfoliation by ions, exfoliation by ultrasonic cleaners, etc. Please speculate if the flake shaped particles would have sharp cutting edges after ball milling or exfoliation during ultrasonic cleaning. OPTIONAL Milestone 4 :  Budgets $20.00  14 days At your university or lab, do you have access to software : Software that estimates the zeta potential of simple compounds? Software that estimates bandgap of simple compounds?   Software that estimates the bandgap of doped simple compounds? If you have these softwares, you and I will can agree  to run the software for several of the chemicals you propose. MILESTONE 5, Budget $25.00, Duration 5 days : After you and I agree to several candidate chemicals, you will review the scientific literature, and try to find examples of green diodes.  For example, the scientific literature has numerous articles about silicon dioxide composite diodes. You will prepare a simple list of the scientific articles, and send url addresses for the articles. The OUTPUT of this project can be a simple spreadsheet, with your suggested compositions of chemicals, with your comments, along with a list of the scientific articles which confirm your ideas. Some of the information in this posting is contained in our patents, including patents 11094839 and  11063164. Thank you for reading this posting.Skills: Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Materials Engineering

title: Help creating a bucket/IAM/ACL for my AWS S3 bucket - Upwork
description: Hi all, Rather than embarrass myself on StackOverflow I decided to post on here! I am currently building a side project website - an image marketplace - where, via my website users can upload images to an S3 bucket. On image upload two things happen: Bucket 1) I am using Watermark.js to watermark the image before it gets uploaded. This image will be uploaded to a public bucket (I may also compress the image as well). These are the images that will display on the website for others to view and decide if they want to purchase. Bucket 2) The raw, un-watermarked image will be stored in another bucket, where the access cannot be completely public - like bucket 1 (because anyone can view all the objects in the bucket and download them). This is where I am becoming stuck. I don't know enough about bucket/IAM policies to know what the best solution is. Can I implement a policy of some sort that enables my website to display the urls/images of the objects in bucket 2, but doesn't allow the public to see all the objects in the bucket? (it would be great to show the raw, un-watermarked images in a users profile for example) If not, then i guess it would need to be a private bucket, that my website requests a image from when it needs to be downloaded? Any advice and help writing this policy would be great! Best, JamesSkills: Amazon Web Services

title: SCR control and load monitoring - Upwork
description: SCR control and load monitoring The project to program ATTiny 404 microcontroller to generate control voltage for the SCR gate and to detect if there is a load connected to that SCR or not. The code will be written in C (I have MPLAB ide v6.2 compiler) with a parameter file where I can change the parameters values There will be two deliverables written and documented in C: Test:  generate the pulses shown in the graph under the AC wave continuously (repetitively) at the zero crossing instants and I will experiment with values for t1, t2, t3, t4, t5. Operational mode: Each analog signal :zerocrossing (4Vpp 60Hz), Load1_adc, Load2_adc, and Load3_adc is less than 5Vp-p and is sampled at 960 Hz (16 samples per AC wave). These ac signals are riding on VDD/2 dc (we can use the MSB toggling of the ADC output as zero crossing indication) On power ON: 1. Find the positive zero crossing instant (MSB flips from 0 to 1) 2. Generate the pulses described in Test with values of t1,t2,t3,t4, t5, values set in the parameter file on SCR1, SCR2 and SCR3. After the pattern, the voltage is set to zero for 2,500,000 micro seconds (2.5 seconds) then the voltage on the three pins is set to “1” 3. After SCR pins are set to “1”, on positive zero crossing (zerocrossing signal MSB flips from 0 to 1) sample the analog signals Load1_adc, Load2_adc, and Load3_adc at 960 Hz each, and accumulate 8 samples of each. If any of them[b6b5b4b3b2b1b0] is less than 127 (0x7F), the corresponding SCR gate voltage is set to zero until there is a new power ON process 4. If the ADC reading of any load is more than or equal to 0x3C0 (960 decimal), the corresponding SCR pin is set to 0 and stays 0 until new power ON SDA and SCL pins are just in case uC is connected to a larger one (do they need to be configured?).  The pin assignment can be changed I also need information on how to program ATTINY404 (pins, pin connection, …etc). title: I need a ROS project  - Upwork
description: Showing the implementation of a robotic assistance system for people with disabilities using ROS (Robot Operating System) involves several key steps. This includes setting up your ROS environment, developing your application's components as ROS nodes, and ensuring that these components communicate effectively to perform the intended functions. Here's a structured approach to demonstrating your implementation: 1. Define Your System's Architecture Identify Components: Break down your system into key components, such as sensor data acquisition (ECG, accelerometer, gyroscope, PPG), data processing (e.g., particle filter algorithm), decision-making (emergency response, daily assistance tasks), and user interface. Design ROS Nodes: Plan which parts of your system will be implemented as separate ROS nodes. For example, each sensor might have its own node for data collection, and another node might implement the particle filter for data analysis. 2. Set Up the ROS Environment Install ROS: Choose the appropriate ROS version (ROS 1 or ROS 2) for your project and install it on your development machine or robot's onboard computer. Create a ROS Workspace: Set up a workspace where you'll develop your project's packages. 3. Implement ROS Nodes Sensor Nodes: Implement nodes that interface with each sensor to collect data. These nodes will publish sensor data using ROS topics. Processing Node: Develop a node that subscribes to the sensor data topics, applies the particle filter algorithm (or any other analysis algorithms), and determines the system's response based on the processed data. Action Nodes: Create nodes responsible for taking actions, such as sending alerts, communicating with emergency services, or controlling robotic mechanisms to assist the user. User Interface Node: If your system includes a user interface, develop a node that allows users to interact with the system, configuring settings, and receiving notifications. 4. Integrate and Test Integration: Ensure that all nodes are correctly integrated, subscribing to the necessary topics, and communicating as expected. Simulation and Visualization: Use tools like Gazebo for simulating your robotic system and Rviz for visualizing sensor data and the robot's actions. This is crucial for testing your system in a controlled environment. Testing: Conduct thorough testing to ensure reliability, including handling sensor noise, responding to emergency conditions, and interacting with the user. 5. Demonstration Prepare Your Demonstration: Plan a demonstration that showcases how your robotic assistance system can help people with disabilities. This might include simulated scenarios that highlight the system's responsiveness to falls, health emergencies, or daily assistance tasks. Live Demonstration: Use your ROS setup to run the system in real-time, potentially employing a robot or a simulated environment to show the system in action. Demonstrate how sensor data is collected, processed, and how the system responds to different conditions. 6. Documentation and Explanation Document Your Work: Provide clear documentation on how your system is designed, how each component works, and how to set up and run your system. Explain During the Demonstration: As you demonstrate the system, explain the role of each component, how data flows between nodes, and how decisions are made and executed within the system. Final Notes Showing an implementation in ROS, especially for a complex system like robotic assistance for people with disabilities, requires careful planning, development, and testing. Emphasize the modularity and flexibility of ROS, which allows your system to be expanded or modified as new needs or technologies emerge.Skills: Python, C++, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning, Robot Operating System, Machine Learning, AWS IoT Core, Control Engineering, Internet of Things, Robotics, CUDA, JavaScript, WebRTC, Ubuntu, Deep Learning

title: Micropython script on Raspberry Pi Pico for AWS MQTT communication over a SIM7020E - Upwork
description: #### Abstract #### We need a Raspberry Pi Pico W to be able to send and receive JSON encoded data to AWS via MQTT over the NB-IoT cellular network. #### Progress #### We are well down the road on this with everything working using the built in WiFi on the Pico. We are using AWS Shadow to keep device config sync'd and then normal pub/sub to and from AWS topics with "AWS IoT rules" setup to store incoming MQTT data on each topic to Dynamo DB. This is all working perfectly utilising a mqtt_as.py script (see attached file mqtt_as.txt) and crucially, works in a "non blocking" way so other code can run whilst the script is listening for incoming MQTT messages to subscribed topics. Our next step is to replace using the onboard WiFi and instead to do the comms over the mobile network, and we are using the SIM7020E NB-IoT Module (https://thepihut.com/products/sim7020e-nb-iot-module-for-raspberry-pi-pico?variant=40797269655747) to achieve this. Again we are down the road on this but have hit a brick wall with our lack of experience in the raw AT commands that the sim module uses to communicate. We can successfully get the module to connect to the data network (via a 1NCE IoT sim card) and say that it's "OK" and working, but when we follow the documentation for making MQTT requests (especially with needing to send the various AWS security certificates, with line endings, and them needing to be chunked over multiple commands due to max char limitations etc) we get errors or can't get it to work. Due to upworks description character limit I have detailed the requirements for this project in the attached file "Requirements.txt" Look forward to working with you on this, Many thanks for your time, BenSkills: Python, Raspberry Pi, Raspberry Pi Firmware, AWS IoT Core, Python Script, Amazon Web Services, MQTT

title: Create Windows installer that wraps several dependencies - Upwork
description: This project is to create a Windows installer that places the following things on a user's Windows computer: * AWS Greengrass Core software * Java (prerequisite for AWS Greengrass) * Configuration file for AWS Greengrass core (different for each installation) * Certificate and private key files for AWS Greengrass core (different for each installation) * Python & C-runtime (for Python) For your information, not part of this project: AWS Greengrass Core is a piece of software that runs as a system service on the PC and maintains a connection to the AWS cloud. Once Greengrass Core is installed on a PC and the cloud connection exists, it is possible to push "Greengrass components" from the cloud and run them in the background without user interaction. I will use this to push components that are Python scripts. This is why AWS Greengrass Core needs to be installed as a background task and why the installer must include Python. The requirement for this project is that the installer is a single file (.exe or .msi) that I can double click to install all four parts mentioned above. The installer should ask me in which folder I want to install all parts (probably in `C:\Programs Files`). The installer must also ask me to upload three files (see below for details). When the installer is done, AWS Greengrass Core must be running on my Windows PC. When I restart the Windows PC Greengrass must automatically start. I don't care how you implement the installer as long as it works on the current versions of Windows. From my research I understand that "WiX Toolset" and "InnoSetup" are popular choices. If you want to use software that has a license cost you must ask me before proceeding (I will probably say yes but want to look at it first). The following are details about the different parts that need to be installed: AWS Greengrass Core You can read about Greengrass in general here: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/what-is-iot-greengrass.html The installer basically needs to complete the steps described in this documentation as "manual install": https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/manual-installation.html#run-greengrass-core-v2-installer-manual Basically, there are some setup steps and then this command must be run: java -Droot="C:\path\to\greengrass\v2" "-Dlog.store=FILE" ^   -jar ./GreengrassInstaller/lib/Greengrass.jar ^   --init-config my-custom-config-file.yaml ^   --component-default-user ggc_user ^   --setup-system-service true`a As you can see, this requires Java and a config file. Let's talk about these next. Java Correct me if I'm wrong, but it's probably best if I include a copy of Java in the installer. I want to use some version of OpenJDK and think Amazon Corretto is the best choice: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/corretto/latest/corretto-21-ug/downloads-list.html Configuration file The documentation for how to install Greengrass has an example of the configuration file. The file contains the folder path to Greengrass in a few places. Only the installer knows what this path is, so it needs to put this path into the file. Some other information in the config file is stuff the installer does not know by itself, for example "iotDataEndpoint". So I propose that the user uploads an incomplete configuration file, then the installer adds the folder paths. Certificate and private key files These are two files that every user will have. I can generate two for you for testing if that's needed. Note that the configuration file contains the path where these are stored, make sure the installer actually puts them into this place. Python & C Redistributable Find the "Windows installer (64-bit)" for the most recent release of Python 3.11 here: https://www.python.org/downloads/. Read more about the Embeddable Package here: https://docs.python.org/3/using/windows.html#the-embeddable-package. Python is written in C, so the C runtime is needed. Skills: Application Installer, Microsoft Windows, InstallShield, Desktop Application

title: Geothermal engineering study - Upwork
description: Geothermal Engineer for Single-Well Low-Cost Power Generation Feasibility Study Our company is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Geothermal Engineer to conduct a feasibility study and perform calculations for an innovative single-well, low-cost geothermal power generation system. The successful candidate will assess the technical and economic viability of this concept and provide a detailed report on the potential energy output at the wellhead. Project Overview: We are exploring the possibility of utilizing a single deep well for a closed-loop geothermal system to generate electricity. The concept involves installing two pipes (supply and return) in the well, with a heat exchanger at the bottom to transfer heat from the surrounding rock formation to the circulating fluid. The hot fluid will be used to drive a binary cycle power plant at the surface. Key Responsibilities: 1. Review the project concept and gather necessary data on the local geological conditions, geothermal resource characteristics, and existing well information. 2. Develop a detailed model of the single-well geothermal system, including the well configuration, heat exchanger design, and fluid circulation parameters. 3. Perform thermodynamic and fluid dynamic calculations to estimate the heat transfer rate, fluid temperature, and flow rate at the wellhead. 4. Evaluate the potential power generation capacity of the system based on the wellhead energy and the efficiency of the binary cycle power plant. 5. Identify potential technical challenges and risks associated with the single-well design and propose mitigation strategies. 6. Conduct a preliminary economic analysis of the project, considering capital costs, operating expenses, and potential revenue from electricity sales. 7. Prepare a comprehensive feasibility report summarizing the technical findings, energy output estimates, economic analysis, and recommendations for further development. Required Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in mechanical, civil, or petroleum engineering, or a related field (e.g., geophysics, geological engineering). - Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in geothermal energy projects, with a focus on system design, modeling, and analysis. - Strong knowledge of thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and heat transfer principles applied to geothermal systems. - Experience with geothermal reservoir modeling and simulation software (e.g., TOUGH2, FEFLOW, CMG STARS). - Familiarity with binary cycle power plants and their integration with geothermal heat sources. - Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills. Preferred Qualifications: - Master's degree or Ph.D. in geothermal engineering, renewable energy, or a related field. - Experience with closed-loop geothermal systems or single-well designs. - Professional certification, such as the Certified Geothermal Designer (CGD) credential. - Membership in geothermal industry organizations (e.g., Geothermal Resources Council, International Geothermal Association). Deliverables: 1. Detailed model of the single-well geothermal system. 2. Calculations and estimates of the heat transfer rate, fluid temperature, and flow rate at the wellhead. 3. Assessment of the potential power generation capacity at the wellhead. 4. Identification of technical challenges, risks, and mitigation strategies. 5. Preliminary economic analysis of the project. 6. Comprehensive feasibility report with technical findings, energy output estimates, economic analysis, and recommendations. If you are a passionate and experienced Geothermal Engineer excited about the opportunity to evaluate this innovative single-well, low-cost power generation concept, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume, cover letter, and relevant project portfolio to [insert contact information].Skills: Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Simulation, Petroleum Engineering, Chemical Engineering

title: SOC Analyst & VA/PT - Upwork
description: SOC 1, or Service Organization Control 1, is a type of report that provides information about a service organization's internal controls over financial reporting. It is part of the broader SOC framework developed by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) to help organizations assess and communicate their control environments to customers, regulators, and other stakeholders. Here are key points about SOC 1 reports: 1. **Purpose**: SOC 1 reports are specifically designed for service organizations that provide services that could impact their clients' financial statements. These services might include processing financial transactions, managing payroll, or providing other outsourced services related to financial reporting. 2. **Type 1 vs. Type 2**: There are two types of SOC 1 reports:    - **Type 1**: Reports on the fairness of the service organization's presentation of its controls at a specific point in time.    - **Type 2**: Reports on the effectiveness of the service organization's controls over a period of time, typically covering at least six months. 3. **Control Objectives**: SOC 1 reports focus on control objectives related to financial reporting. These objectives ensure that the service organization's internal controls are designed and operating effectively to mitigate the risk of material misstatements in their clients' financial statements. 4. **Scope**: The scope of a SOC 1 report includes a description of the service organization's system and the controls implemented to achieve the specified control objectives. This description is typically provided by management and is assessed by an independent auditor. 5. **Audience**: SOC 1 reports are primarily intended for the service organization's customers and their auditors. They help customers evaluate the adequacy of controls in place to support their financial reporting requirements and may be requested as part of the due diligence process or regulatory compliance. 6. **Report Components**: A SOC 1 report typically includes:    - A description of the service organization's system and the services provided.    - Management's assertion about the effectiveness of controls.    - The auditor's opinion on the fairness of management's assertion.    - Details of any control deficiencies or exceptions identified during the audit. In summary, SOC 1 reports are essential for service organizations that handle financial data for their clients. These reports provide assurance to customers and stakeholders regarding the reliability and security of the service organization's controls related to financial reporting processes.Skills: English, SOC 1

title: Custom Booking and Guest Information Organization System for Ski Resort - Upwork
description: Background: At Iwanai Resort, we are committed to enhancing the customer experience and simplifying our reservation processes. To achieve this, we plan to implement a customized payment and booking system tailored to our needs. This system will seamlessly integrate with our existing website and address the following key requirements: Key Requirements: 1. Effortless Package Purchases: Our clients should have a seamless booking experience, allowing them to easily purchase multiple-day packages and reserve private snow CATS, along with any other services we offer. 4. Data from various sectors such as Guides, Rental Shop, Hotel, Transportation, and Hutte Kitchen will be consolidated and organized within the system. 5. Participant Sign-Up and Last-Minute Booking: Each CAT participant must sign up individually, agreeing to our terms and conditions and providing essential details. The system should also accommodate last-minute bookings without compromising efficiency or accuracy. 6. Waiting List Integration: The system needs to incorporate a waiting list feature for individuals unable to book their desired dates. 7. Guide Notes and Client Blacklisting: We require a system for guides to make notes and potentially blacklist clients from returning to our mountain. 8. Automated Communication: Upon successful gathering of information and payment, guests should receive an automatic email detailing arrival instructions and preparation tips for their visit. 9. Emphasis on Participant Responsibilities: We will emphasize that all participants read and review our terms and conditions. We strongly advise all participants to purchase travel cancellation insurance. 10. Client Data Storage: Client data will be securely saved for future visits, enhancing ease of use for both guests and staff. Group/Individual Information Collection: • Basic Information: Full name, date of birth, sex, nationality, email, and phone number.• Ski Information: Details include whether the participant is a skier or boarder, ability level, frequency of skiing per season, experience in backcountry and deep powder snow, preexisting health conditions, ownership of a beacon, and rental equipment requirements. • Transfers and Accommodation: Information regarding means of transportation, pick-up location in Niseko, dietary requirements, food allergies, and accommodation details including check-in/check-out times and meal preferences. Information Collection: Basic information, ski details, and transfer/accommodation preferences will be collected from each participant to ensure a personalized experience. Accounting Integration: The system will seamlessly integrate with payment processing platforms like Stripe and provide comprehensive accounting features to track payments and revenue accurately. Conclusion: By implementing this comprehensive booking and guest information organization system, Iwanai Resort aims to optimize reservations, enhance customer satisfaction, and streamline operations, ultimately providing an improved snow CAT experience for our guests.Skills: Booking Management System, Information Gathering, WordPress Website Design

title: NGO Website Development - Upwork
description: We are looking for a skilled web developer to help us create a website for a Namibian community organization. The website will serve as a platform for information and resource sharing among members and will also be used to raise awareness about our organization's initiatives and goals. We require someone with experience in website development and a strong understanding of responsive design, user-friendly interfaces, and search engine optimization (SEO). The developer should be familiar with website platforms such as WordPress or Joomla, and have a good grasp of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines are essential. Skills needed: - Website development - Responsive design - User-friendly interfaces - Search engine optimization (SEO) - HTML - CSS - JavaScript Business Plan: Namibian Informative Organization (NIO) - Desalination Project Executive Summary Namibian Informative Organization (NIO) is a groundbreaking platform designed to empower communities in Namibia by providing total transparency in fundraising and decision-making for community development projects. NIO's flagship initiative is the implementation of a self-sustaining desalination project in the town of Uis, fortified by educational initiatives and infrastructure development. This project aims to address critical challenges faced by the community, such as water scarcity, while fostering economic empowerment and self-reliance. Mission Statement NIO's mission is to empower Namibian communities to address their challenges and improve their quality of life through transparent and democratic decision-making processes, with a focus on sustainable development. Objectives Implement a self-sustaining desalination project in Uis, Namibia, to provide a reliable and safe water supply for all residents. Enhance economic empowerment and self-reliance in Uis through educational initiatives and infrastructure development. Demonstrate a model of sustainable development that can be replicated in other towns and villages across Namibia. Market Analysis Namibia faces various challenges in its towns and villages, including poverty, inadequate infrastructure, and limited access to basic services. These challenges require innovative solutions that empower communities to take charge of their development. NIO's desalination project addresses these challenges by providing a reliable water supply, creating jobs, and stimulating economic activity in Uis. Services Fundraising: NIO will allow users to contribute funds towards the desalination project and other community development projects. Project Proposals: Users can propose projects that address community needs, with a focus on sustainability and economic empowerment. Voting: Users can vote on which projects to prioritize, ensuring that community priorities are reflected in the decision-making process. Marketing Strategy NIO will utilize a multi-faceted marketing strategy to reach its target audience, including social media campaigns, community outreach programs, and partnerships with local organizations. The platform's transparency and accountability features will be highlighted to build trust with users and attract new users to the platform. Financial Projections Revenue Model: NIO will collect contributions from users, with each citizen of Namibia being asked to contribute. Cost Estimates: Funding Sources: In addition to user contributions, NIO will seek funding from government grants, international donors, and private investors to support the project. Implementation Timeline Planning Phase: Conduct feasibility studies, cost estimates, and stakeholder consultations Fundraising Phase: Launch fundraising campaigns on the NIO platform and seek external funding Construction Phase: Build the desalination plant, infrastructure, and educational facilities Operational Phase: Start operations of  educational programs, ensuring ongoing monitoring and maintenance (ongoing). Benefits to the Community Water Security: The desalination plant will provide a reliable and safe water supply for all residents of a  critical need in the community. Economic Empowerment: The project will create jobs, enhance skills, and stimulate economic activity  leading to long-term prosperity. Environmental Sustainability: By using solar panels and other sustainable technologies, the project will contribute to environmental conservation and sustainable development. Conclusion Namibian Informative Organization (NIO) is poised to revolutionize community development in Namibia through its innovative and sustainable approach. By integrating into the NIO platform, the community can realize its vision of a self-sustaining future built on resilience, prosperity, and unity. With the support of every citizen of Namibia, NIO can serve as a model for community-driven development that empowers communities to address their challenges and build a better future for all.Skills: Web Development, Web Design, WordPress, HTML, CSS

title: Marketing virtual assistant needed for lead management - Upwork
description: Please see attached document for complete job description and detailed task breakdown. ## **Job Title** --- Marketing virtual assistant needed for lead management ## **Overview of Responsibilities** --- We are seeking a motivated, organized and thorough individual to assist with marketing activities for a venture funded SaaS startup in the U.S.. The ideal candidate is available for part time work on an ongoing basis. Typical responsibilities will include: - Building and enriching lead lists using Google Sheets & LinkedIn - Qualifying leads based on a clear set of criteria - Drafting personalized email outreach using existing templates - Scheduling meetings with prospects ## Projects --- ### Initial Evaluation Project **Goal:** The goal of this project is to determine if the candidate is the right fit for the job going forward. There is strong potential for additional work on an ongoing basis if the right candidate is found. **Scope:** The project involves three primary tasks. You will be working independently on these tasks. 1. **Task 1 - Lead list enrichment:** Starting with 50 email addresses captured from content downloads and a Google Sheets template, you will build a lead list. Emails captured will be forwarded to your email inbox. Example email and spreadsheet shown below.          ![Upwork 001.png](https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/e203070b-21f8-4184-9c5b-65a422b95070/09d8509b-e3dd-4400-9add-054d8b4b8554/Upwork_001.png)          ![Upwork 002.png](https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/e203070b-21f8-4184-9c5b-65a422b95070/db504bdd-d4b2-4f55-aeaa-b5a945ae7703/Upwork_002.png)          - You will be responsible for finding the prospect’s name and LinkedIn account based on their email address. We recognize that this task is not possible for all prospects because a small portion of them will not have a LinkedIn account or enough public information on social media to confidently identify them. Thats OK! Just do your best and be sure you only add names and LinkedIn profiles to the spreadsheet if you are extremely confident they are accurate.     - You will also be responsible for filling out the following fields in each spreadsheet entry:         - Week Of: Monday’s date for the current work week.         - Cohort: a value you will be given on a per job basis         - Related content: selection from a dropdown associated with the piece of content the prospect downloaded. This information is in the emails you will be forwarded. 2. **Task 2 - Email drafting using templates:** Starting with a set of email templates for each piece of downloadable content, you will draft emails to each prospect in the spreadsheet. Emails will be drafted in a single Google Document. **Important: You will not be sending emails to any candidates during the entirety of this project.** You are solely responsible for developing draft emails.  The Google Doc that you will be using looks like this. ![Untitled](https://prod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/e203070b-21f8-4184-9c5b-65a422b95070/6d0853e0-4893-43c7-8770-ccf60b0280d6/Untitled.png) **Note:** Be sure to use the format in the Google Doc so that emails can be easily converted into my Gmail account. The Google Document will also include the email templates with guidance on where and how to personalize or customize the emails for each prospect. 1. **Task 3 - Lead qualification and data cleanup:** Starting with a CSV export from Taplio, you will review each lead in the spreadsheet and qualify or disqualify them based on clear criteria (exact criteria will be shared in the spreadsheet). The initial spreadsheet will include 101 prospects for evaluation. Please clearly mark which prospects are qualified and which are disqualified. Please add the qualified prospects to the spreadsheet used in Task 1 and update the ‘Cohort’ field to ‘Taplio’ for each prospect copied over. Skills: Data Entry, Lead Generation, Email Marketing, Administrative Support, Email Communication, Scheduling

title: Game Keybind Learning Program - Upwork
description: We are seeking a user-friendly program that focuses on practicing custom key binds and specific rotations. The program should offer a range of features to enhance accuracy, speed, and overall performance without the risk of in-game death. One essential feature is the inclusion of timers to track the duration of each key bind. These timers should seamlessly integrate into the program's interface to avoid interrupting gameplay. They will provide valuable insights into performance and areas for improvement. Additionally, the program should display the exact keys required for each key bind. This feature will facilitate learning and memorization of key combinations during gameplay. The program must have a highly intuitive and user-friendly interface. It should be effortless to input preferred key binds and monitor progress. Simplicity is key, allowing players to focus on the game without unnecessary complications. Customization of key binds should also be possible. We are excited about finding a program that revolutionizes the way we learn and master key binds in our game. The program should include ability icons, accurate timers, visible keystrokes, and customizable key binds. A user-friendly interface is paramount. Furthermore, we require the program to randomly send key binds or practice specific rotations either after a certain amount of time or in a random order. It is crucial that the key bind entries align with the game's timing system, with the timer adjusting in "ticks" of 0.6 seconds per tick. The program should also offer the ability to toggle individual key bind inputs, ability icons, and sound muting. Players should have the flexibility to choose between icons only, sounds only, key bind inputs only, or any combination thereof. To aid in the development of this program, we are willing to create a new account, purchase a membership for that account, and grant the programmer access. This will allow them to reference, test, and obtain icons. We will also provide access to the game's official wiki page, which contains technical information such as the timing system and global cooldown. The program can be developed in one of three stages of completion: 1. Empty Program: - Create a functional program that incorporates all the mentioned features. - The program should be able to utilize all the features. - This stage of completion would be during or directly after the initial testing phase of the program. - This my preferred level of completion. This would ensure a quicker completion while allowing myself to test everything to locate any and all bugs that would require your attention. - I will have ample time to test, log any bug(s), and interact with all of the features. - If I found any bugs/issues I would collect evidence in the form of written notes, screenshots, videos etc. providing you all the information for a speedy debug phase if any. - I take the functional program and complete the setup myself. To test the functionality and get accustom to the UI incase I want to change/add anything. -  I acquire, resize, and add the ability/function icons to a library. - I add all of the sound clips on a one to one ratio, - I assign all of the key binds, etc. 2. Partly Filled Program: - Expand the program to include ability icons from the 4 combat styles and the 2 universal styles (defensive, constitution). - Approximately 140 named icons should be included. - This would be the next stage of preferred completion allowing myself still a fair amount of time to test, log any bug(s), and setup all of the customizable features. 3. Filled Program: - Extend the program to encompass every possible ability icon from all 4 combat styles, 2 universal styles, and non-combat functions such as food and potions. - Well over 250+ ability/function icons added to a "library", ability names, 250+ individual sound clips should be included. The User-Friendly UI should feature a resizable screen window and include the following desired functions: - Select User: Allow users to personalize settings, key bind loadouts, rotations, and more. - Create User Profile: Enable users to create individual profiles with specific settings, key bind loadouts, speeds, rotations, etc. - Add Key Bind: Provide the option to create new key binds or modify existing ones to be added to the randomized pool. - Add Rotation: Allow users to determine the order in which key binds appear in a rotation. Customization options such as time limits, allowable mistakes, and progression settings should be available. The creation of new key binds should include the following features: - An interactive keyboard representing a full-size keyboard. - Keys associated with existing key binds should be locked or blacked out. - The ability to add a prefix, such as "Shift," "Ctrl," or "Alt," to key binds. - Options to include pictures or colors for quick identification. - The ability to name each key bind. - The option to attach sound to each key bind.Skills: Game Design, Python, Game Design Document, Game Development, C#

title: design uppgrade of an existing SaaS  - Upwork
description: Our platform is a software application available on computers and mobile devices. Its main function is to guide users through often transformative or complex support journeys (sustainability, digitalization, employability). More information at copilotpro.co. The software application is used by various companies in different sectors. This software application consists of a back end (called the cockpit) and a front end (referred to as the "user space" or more simply as the "roadmap"). The application is used by three target audiences, each with their own specific use: - Administrators can autonomously create a complete support experience with simple drag-and-drop tools. For this, they use the back end. - End users follow the support deployed by the administrators, so they can progress step by step and record this advancement. They use the front end. - Managers (an "optional" group because they are not mandatory) generally manage a group of users in the context of digital/human hybrid support (e.g., a business creation advisor who has several companies). They use the front end. A support journey is materialized by the user's roadmap. This roadmap is the central element of our interfaces; it is also our unique and different creative and visual asset (our goal is therefore to improve it and continue to make it our identity marker). The roadmap consists of the following elements: - The mission: it is the "unit" of the support we offer, and it can take several forms:   o Elearning   o Step-by-step guide   o Certification   o Collective challenge (future feature) - The question: it allows posing a question to personalize the content that follows, and it also serves to block the display of content below to prevent visually "overloading" the roadmap. - The call to action: it highlights a short action (clicking a link, etc.) that does not require multiple steps. - The info bubble: It highlights a short piece of information (often a video or a short text) without necessarily requiring action, so it is informative. Actions: 1. Modernization of the back office design (goal: a single design identity between back and front). Pages to work on: (see appendix 3)    a. Roadmap page (with blocks)    b. Page with a table (for example, the accounts page)    c. Analytics page.    d. Page for adding a badge 2. Modernization of the front office design (without changing UX), with the goal of making it a little less "stark" (very few images/cold currently).    a. Roadmap (plan to add "tags" for each mission, for example for MED to write: "valid for" "B Corp")    b. Accomplishment page    c. Open mission    d. Marketplace (find an expert)    e. Elearning (Matthieu will provide a screenshot)    f. Subscription page 3. Creation of the design for a new feature "goal tracking"Skills: UX & UI, Web Design

title: Video Streaming (NodeJs) - Upwork
description: Problem statement: Our current proctoring system relies on WebRTC technology to facilitate the recording of videos for our proctoring services. This involves engaging both the microphone and webcam functionalities. The backend infrastructure is supported by NodeJS, which acts as the server for receiving video data transmitted in chunks, frame by frame, in its raw format. Upon completion of an exam, the recorded video undergoes a conversion process to render it playable. Subsequently, the converted video is stored on both our server and our archive storage system, S3. While our system generally operates effectively, we encounter challenges when users experience connection interruptions or encounter camera issues on their computers. In such instances, the transmission of video frames may become out of sync, resulting in corrupted video files. As a result, we must reconvert these files and attempt to recover them for proper functionality. At present, our conversion process achieves success rates of 65%, with the remaining 35% of videos encountering conversion failures. Usually, it's because of missing headers. Current Issues: NaN & Undefined files get created when there are connection issues on the student’s PC. These NaN, and undefined videos are videos with bad Metadeta. Each person has a different connection speed to our server. We’ve tried to keep the frame rates very low to minimize the bandwidth. Steps we need help with: Find a reasonable solution to the above problem, where we don’t lose videos. Do a code review of the server.js on the NodeJs side and see if we can pinpoint why the NaN / Undefined files get created.Skills: MySQL, Node.js, Video Stream, JavaScript, FFmpeg, Socket.io, WebRTC, API, Amazon Web Services

title: Comparative historical real estate research. - Upwork
description: Research Problem: Exploring Historical Real Estate Trends: Identifying Patterns of Price Discrepancies in various residential market segments Introduction: In light of the significant price discrepancies observed in contemporary residential real estate markets between high and low segments, this research aims to conduct a comprehensive analysis of historical real estate trends. By delving into past instances of similar disparities, the study seeks to elucidate if lower priced markets follow the general market devoid of external factors or if they normalize up at a higher rate than the market average. Research Questions: Contemporary Market Analysis: What is the range of real estate prices across mid-tier markets in the continental US, after excluding extreme outliers (top and bottom 5 percentile), and controlling for variables such as home size etc. Historical Comparison: Can historical periods be identified where similar disparities in real estate prices existed that are similar to our current distribution. Post-Disparity Analysis: If such historical periods are identified, what were the subsequent trends in the lower segments of those markets 10-20 years later compared to national average trends? Factors Driving Market Growth: If lower-tier markets experienced higher-than-average growth rates post-disparity, what were the underlying reasons? Was it a natural market correction or were there specific catalysts driving the appreciation? Research Goal: The overarching goal is to pinpoint historical epochs analogous to the current market conditions and assess if those lower market segments are likely to experience gains larger than the general market. By rigorously analyzing past trends while controlling for external factors, the study aims to provide insights into the likelihood of repressed markets normalizing upwards compared to the national average. Scope and Limitations: The study will focus on real estate markets in the continental US with populations exceeding 50,000. although if data is more easily accessible, analysis on a county level could also be entertained. External factors such as industry shifts will be excluded from the analysis to isolate the impact of price disparities. The research will aim to hold as many variables constant as possible to ensure the validity of comparative analyses.Skills: Market Research, Research Methods, Real Estate Financial Modeling, Economic Analysis

title: Implement Natural & Realistic Text-to-Speech Functionality into React Native iOS Application - Upwork
description: We are currently developing an iOS app using React Native, designed for voice chat functionality. Within this app, we aim to incorporate Text-to-Speech (TTS) capabilities utilizing voices similar to those of Siri, which exhibit natural and realistic qualities. Presently, our TTS functionality relies on the React-native-tts library; however, we find that the produced speech sounds somewhat mechanical. We are open to exploring alternative libraries or frameworks compatible with iPhones, such as Swift, React Native, or Flutter, to enhance the naturalness and realism of the voices. To ensure minimal latency in our app, we prefer utilizing a locally available speech synthesizer. This could be a native iOS synthesizer or a custom-built synthesizer tailored to our specific needs. Furthermore, we are open to including the voice assets directly within our app bundle, provided they maintain a natural and realistic sound quality. When the character responds, audio is played (from AWS Polly) with a voice speaking their response. I want to change the image of the character to a WebGL 3D rendering where the character appears to be talking to you, but with their mouth moving in sync with the audio. I want to build a Unity WebGL application to replace the character photo above the chat. The character should be looking at you, and moving slightly, located in a park. I want to use custom character assets from Adobe Fuse, rigged with Mixamo, and imported into Unity with blendshapes. I will create a service call in my system to Azure Speech which will generate blendshapes data from the existing audio file from AWS Polly.  I want the WebGL application to receive external data for these blendshapes, and animate the character speaking upon request using these. The audio will continue to play simultaneously on the website. The graphics should look like this or better: https://ventureblocks.com/demo I have the assets for the park and the bear-like pets for Unity. title: Needed ASAP: Video on word press site to move to 3rd party platform and not affect prior purchases - Upwork
description: I currently have a website for a film that I produced where customers can rent or purchase the film. The film is currently uploaded to the website. However, a lot of people have been having issues when trying to watch the film after they rented/purchased as it will buffer for them. It seems that the solution to this problem is to change it so that the video isn't uploaded to the website but is instead uploaded to a 3rd party platform. Here is what I need: 1. I need you to upload the file to a 3rd party platform (i.e. bunny.net.) Any fees associated with being on the 3rd party platform will be either added onto your payment, or if you just let me know which platform it will be, I will buy the membership and give you the login. 2. We need to use a platform in which people cannot watch the video for free. The way it works on the website currently is people will buy/rent the film and then they will be redirected to the "watch now" page that that they cannot access unless they pay for the film. Something like vimeo or youtube will not work because they could just get the link for free. 3. We need to keep the process the same as it currently is. When they click "buy now" and purchase the film, they need to be redirected to the "watch now" page the same way they currently are, but then to have the film play through the 3rd party plugin instead of the direct website upload as it currently is. I don't want anything about the website to change aside from the 3rd party plugin (i.e. customers wouldn't have any idea anything changed if they went back and watched the movie again.) 4. I want to make it so that anyone who has previously bought the film and has been guaranteed permanent access to still have access to the film, despite the 3rd party plugin now being used. Skills: WordPress, WooCommerce, Web Development

title: Website Redesign for Coral Restoration Consortium - Upwork
description: ** see attached for a more detailed description. the below is abbreviated** Request for Proposal: Website Redesign for the Coral Restoration Consortium The Coral Restoration Consortium (CRC) invites experienced Wix web designers to submit proposals for a comprehensive redesign of our website. We are a central hub uniting a global community in the fight to confront the challenge of coral reef degradation through coral restoration activities around the world. The CRC needs a website that not only serves as a beacon for coral restoration efforts but also establishes a foundation for CRC’s ongoing digital presence and community engagement. Design Requirements: The website will encompass 19 pages, with 17 existing and 2 new ones to be designed. The design should align with the CRC brand guide, with an emphasis on searchability, ease of navigation, and showcasing CRC products. The design needs to prioritize accessibility and be as user-friendly as possible in multiple languages. The CRC values a clean, engaging, and easily navigable design, taking inspiration from websites such as animalsintheroom.org. Content Management System (CMS) Requirements: The website must incorporate a user-friendly CMS for ongoing updates, exclusively using Wix as both the platform and the CMS of choice. Existing Website Assessment: A thorough evaluation of the existing website (crc.world) is required, focusing on a collaborative reorganization of the existing site map, and redesigning existing pages.  Content will mostly remain unchanged, and new copy has already been created, so no new copy is needed from the designer, unless an SEO analysis indicates some light copy revisions may be necessary.    Scalability:  The website should be designed with scalability in mind to accommodate continuous additions of new products, such as webinars and whitepapers. Project Support and Communication:  The CRC team seeks 2x/week status updates and wishes to maintain open communication through emails and weekly video calls to ensure project alignment. Timeline:  The project is to be completed within a month, structured as below. This schedule is potentially flexible for the right candidate and can be discussed during the hiring process.   Week 1: Initial design concepts. Weeks 2-3: Design revisions. Week 4: Final implementation and handover of deliverables. Budget:  The total budget for this project is $3500. Should additional services require a revision of the budget, proposals should clearly indicate this.   Evaluation Criteria:  Proposals will be assessed based on the following criteria, with each aspect being crucial to the selection of the successful candidate. In your proposal, please address each of these criteria directly, providing specific examples or case studies where applicable. Our selection process will involve a comprehensive review of how each proposal meets these criteria. Flexibility with Clients: Demonstrated ability to adapt to feedback and changes during the project lifecycle. Please provide examples of past instances where you had to show flexibility in meeting client needs. Attention to Detail: We expect a keen eye for detail to ensure all aspects of the website design and functionality are meticulously crafted and implemented. Candidates should provide evidence of this skill with references to specific elements in their portfolio. Intuitive Eye for Design: The ability to create designs that are not only aesthetically pleasing but also intuitively navigable for users from diverse backgrounds. Proposals should include design samples that showcase this talent. Experience with Wix: Given our requirement for the Wix platform, extensive experience with Wix website development, including the use of its CMS, is essential. Please detail your history with Wix, including the number of projects completed and any particular features of the Wix platform you have utilized. Alignment with CRC’s Mission, Cultural and Market Sensitivity Portfolio Quality, Project Plan Clarity, Creative and Innovative Approach, Budget Adherence, Sustainable Design Considerations, Compliance, and Security Proficiency **Should the designer have a background in creating custom illustrations, we strongly encourage them to include those details in the proposal. ** Proposal Submission:  Proposals should include a portfolio, preliminary project plan, experience with accessible and SEO-friendly design, and confirmation of availability to meet the project timeline. Submissions must be made by Sunday April 7th, 2024 CRC will review submissions by April 12th, 2024, and will begin contacting prospective designers by April 15th, 2024. We expect to begin development by April 20th.   We look forward to partnering with a visionary web designer to create a website that stands at the forefront of the coral restoration movement.  Skills: Website Redesign, User Experience, User Experience Design, UX & UI, Usability Testing, Wix, Web Design

description: Project Overview Title: MarineServiceHub (similar to fiverr or upwork but for marine service proividers) Objective: Develop a specialized marketplace for marine services, facilitating a direct connection between boat owners, buyers, sellers, and service providers. Target Audience: Boat owners, buyers, sellers, and marine service providers (surveyors, transport services, repair technicians, insurance agents, etc.). Detailed Features and Functionalities User Features User Registration and Profiles Service Providers: Profile includes credentials, services offered, pricing, availability, location, certifications, and portfolio. Bidding System: Providers can browse postings and submit bids, including proposed pricing and timelines. Scheduling and Booking Interactive calendar for service providers to indicate availability. Booking system for seekers to schedule and confirm service appointments directly on the platform. Payment Processing Secure payment system supporting multiple payment methods. Escrow functionality to hold payment until service completion, enhancing trust. Review and Rating System Seekers can rate and review providers upon service completion. Scalability Cloud-based infrastructure for easy scaling as the platform grows. Microservices architecture to facilitate the addition of new features or services. Design and UX Requirements User-Centric Design: Focus on creating an intuitive user experience for both service seekers and providers, with easy navigation and a clear call to action. Responsive Web Design: Ensure the platform is accessible and fully functional across devices and browsers.
