title: Firestore/Firebase backend pagination API  - Upwork
description: Issue to be adressed: A set of functioning algorithms designed to reorder posts and comments for a social media app don’t yield the expected result because of how pagination is currently handled with firebase/firestore. Ideally, these algorithm should be executed once when a user first loads the web app, and then the processed data should be stored on the back end without any loss, thus allowing the posts to be simply ‘fetched’ when needed. Instead, the algorithm is currently being ‘called’ with each user action, causing several sorting errors, sometimes losses and sometimes duplicates, and unwanted results. What was already done: Note that there was already a (failed) attempt to fix this issue by creating a backend API that serves the purposes of sorting all results (at intervals of 30 mins) in such a way that users would just pull those results when 'loading' more posts or comments. Unfortuntaely, the other contractor who worked on this approach fell short of offering a solution for a few reasons (miscommunication, errors along the way). We thus need someone who is at least intermediate-advanced (if not expert) on this topic.   Scope: This job will be short because the front-end is already handled, the collections are created, and the sorting algorithms are all done, ready to be 'connected' to the API. Furthermore, (unless we're mistaken) the API shouldn't  have many endpoints as the only expected task it needs to accomplish has to do with sorting.  And of course, if a simpler solution is available that we may have missed, we will happily consider it! Note that this social media app, although very simple to start with, is unique and serves a niche but potentially growing market, and the MVP will be ready for launch as soon as this fix is applied. From there, depending on how the launch goes, the project may grow fast, unlocking more resources. For this reason, after completing this small job, a longer term partnership may certainly develop!   ps: For time zone reasons, we will consider canditates only from the Americas, Europe and Africa. Skills: Firebase Cloud Firestore, Node.js, Web Development, Serverless Stack, Firebase

Product Gallery - Categorization: Organized into various sections such as Dining Sets, Living Room Sets, Bedroom Sets, Home Office Sets, and Wall Panels, each featuring top-selling designs and a flip-page catalog. - Interactive Catalog: Enables users to interact with a flip-page brochure, allowing them to favorite, download, or add products to their cart directly from the catalog. Special Features - 2nd Shopping Technique: Users can upload images of products from the downloaded catalog pages, enabling them to specify and add these items directly to their cart. - Favorites Page: Allows users to manage their favorited items, edit product specifications, and add items to their cart directly from this page. Special Request - Custom Orders: A form enables users to upload images and specify details for custom orders, with the ability to add multiple forms for various items. Cart and Checkout Process - Quote-Based System: Instead of immediate payment, users request quotes for their orders, which are then processed by administrators. Contact, FAQ, and About Pages - These pages will provide standard information, including company background, frequently asked questions, and contact details for customer service. title: Vector database integration - Upwork
description: INTRODUCTION : We're creating a game development platform tailored for creatives without coding skills, inspired by Scratch.com and leveraging its open-source framework. PHASE 1 OVERVIEW : The first phase focuses on storing game data from Scratch—variables and lists—into a vector database like Milvus, QDrant, Vespa, or MongoDB. This MVP phase aims to shield game creators from database complexities, using Phase 1 data to refine our approach for Phase 2. PHASE 2 OVERVIEW : The second phase enhances the interface for game designers to leverage data in more complex games, valuing UX and UI design experience. PHASE 1 DELIVERABLES: Integration Planning and Design: Plan for capturing and seamlessly transferring game data to the database. Scratch Implementation: Set up Scratch on our server, mirroring Scratch.com's environment. Backend Development: Automate data extraction, transformation, and storage. Database Configuration: Set up and optimize the database schema for game data. Automated Data Handling: Ensure data integrity and usability within the database. Testing and QA: Validate data capture, transformation, and storage functionalities. Documentation: Document architecture, technologies, data flow, and maintenance guidelines. PHASE 2 DELIVERABLES: Data Access Layer: Secure data retrieval layer. API: Simplified data access API. Data Visualization Tools: User-friendly data exploration tools. Data Integration with Game Logic: Tools for incorporating data into games. SKILLS REQUIRED (WEIGHTED ON IMPORTANCE): Database Design, Management,Integration(NB Vector Databases) : 8 API design and development : 8 UI/UX Research,test,design : 8 System performance optimization : 7 Quality Assurance,Deployment,Monitoring,Testing,Debugging : 7 User Data Security and Compliance : 7 Data Analytics, Visualization and Reporting : 6.5 Frontend/javascript/html/css/webdev (Scratch sourcecode,variables,lists)  : 6.5 Documentation and Training : 6 Project Management : 6 Please create a table with the above list of skills and add 2 columns 1) weighting of your skills  and 2) a link to work you've done in that regard.Add this table to the top of your introductory proposal.Skills: Database Design

SSI is now looking for candidates who, as a local resident, can survey and provide us state reports of the country you are living, such as the information of security and civil order, etc. If you are interested, please feel free to contact us. The requested reports and tasks are described as follows. 1. State reports of security and civil order, such as demonstrations, riots, political disorders or coups, accidents in large scale, natural disasters, etc. in Republic of Equatorial Guinea.  Reports shall be provided in English or Japanese in A4 format between 3 to 4 pages. Maps and photographs of relevant locations, if available, shall be attached to the reports and works together with its source of the information. Planned schedule of placement of order will be between end of March to beginning of April this year. Delivery of the report shall be one (1) week from the date of the order. Pay is US$500/report. 2. SSI shall review the contents and level of the reports and works in 1 above, and, if SSI determines the candidate is qualified, SSI may continue to outsource other tasks to the candidate.   Notes:  In case that the number of the candidates is large, there may be a case where SSI is not able to outsource. Required skills and conditions.  Ability to collect information from local news, internet, SNS, etc., or, if necessary, to visit to the site or spot to collect information.  Not necessary to be a specialist of risk management.  A person who can keep the due date of the report.  A person who can present information of; 1) profile and background of yourself. 2) your available language. 3) your nationality. 4) how many years you have been living in Republic of Equatorial Guinea so far. And whether you are going to stay in Republic of Equatorial Guinea for more than one(1) year from today, or not.  Meeting us on Zoom (via UPWORK site) is required before we decide to outsource. Note: Application of this job will be closed on or around 15th MarchSkills: English, Writing, Article Writing

title: Stream Salesforce Events to AWS  EventBridge - Upwork
description: NOTE: This is fixed budget project and can't be changed to hourly basis. Looking for a Sr. Salesforce dev experience in integrating Salesforce with AWS to achieve real-time data synchronization. And package the implemented functionality into a Salesforce managed packages. At this time- no security review needed as this package is not yet in appExchange. At this time we simply provide the URL to our client to install this package in their org. Overall Goal - For any CRUD operation on any SF object - build realtime data sycn between SFDC and AWS . Our preferred option is 1. Stream Salesfroce Events to AWS Eventbridge leveraging SF event relays. 2. Leverage a PUb/Sub model if above #1 doesn't work for some reason. Here's what you'll be implementing - Use Event Relays for AWS to send platform events and change data capture events from Salesforce to Amazon EventBridge in AWS link - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=release-notes.rn_event_bus_relay_ga.htm&release=240&type=5 If you're unable to open the link refer to the attached file - page 217 ( Stream Salesforce Events to Amazon EventBridge in AWS (Generally Available) https://resources.docs.salesforce.com/240/latest/en-us/sfdc/pdf/salesforce_winter23_release_notes.pdf Responsibilities: 1. Design and implement a robust integration strategy using Salesforce Platform Events and Change Data Capture (CDC) to monitor and publish real-time data changes. 2. Ensure the solution supports full CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete, undelete) between Salesforce and AWS, providing seamless data synchronization. 3. Package the implemented functionality into our existing Salesforce managed packages for distribution. 4. Collaborate with our AWS developer to ensure smooth end-to-end functionality. Milestone 1(M1): Development in the dev Org - $400 -Enable Change Data Capture (CDC) for relevant Salesforce objects and configure necessary Platform Events. -Develop Apex triggers or classes to publish events to AWS EventBridge or SNS, focusing on real-time synchronization needs (create, update, delete, undelete operations). -Implement basic error handling and logging within Salesforce for monitoring event publication. Milestone 2(M2): Testing & Validation - $300 -Develop and execute detailed test cases to cover all aspects of the integration, including data synchronization accuracy, error handling, and performance under load. -Test the updated managed package in various environments (sandbox, partial copy sandbox, production) to ensure stability -Validate the system's ability to capture and prepare events for AWS, ensuring the setup will integrate smoothly with AWS configurations done by the AWS developer.. Milestone 3(M3): Package & Documentation - $200 -Incorporate the developed features, including Apex code, Platform Events, and CDC configurations, into a managed package, ensuring all components are compatible and functional. -Provide clear documentation for the AWS developer on integrating with the Salesforce setup, including event format, endpoints, and security considerations.Skills: Salesforce CRM, Salesforce App Development, JavaScript, Apex, API

title: AWS Lambda Engineer - Upwork
description: AWS Lambda Engineer - 3 months Contract Our member is working with a digital asset management solution. We are seeking an experienced AWS Lambda Engineer to join our team in building event-driven systems and integrations. As an AWS Lambda engineer, you will be responsible for creating Python Lambdas, for integration with AWS services, and contributing to the development of event-based systems. Profile Descriptions: Responsibilities: - Develop and maintain Python Lambdas on the AWS platform. - Design and implement event-based systems using tools such as EventBridge, SQS, and SNS. - Ensure efficient and effective integration of Lambdas with other AWS services. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust and scalable integrations. Requirements: 4+ years experience in software development Proven experience in Python Experienced on AWS, specifically writing Lambdas Experience with writing "event-based" systems or integrations using tools like EventBridge, SQS, SNS Strong understanding of event-driven architecture and integration patterns. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.Skills: AWS Lambda

title: Experienced Shopify Developer Needed for API Integration with WMS - Upwork
description: We are seeking a highly skilled Shopify developer to create a custom API "bridge" that will seamlessly integrate our Shopify store with our Warehouse Management System (WMS). Requirements: - Proven experience in Shopify app development and API integrations. - Strong knowledge of PHP, specifically Laravel framework, and experience working with AWS services. - Familiarity with front-end technologies (e.g., Vue.js, Axios) for potential adjustments or enhancements on the Shopify side. - Ability to read and interpret technical documents and diagrams to understand the integration requirements fully. - Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. - Strong communication skills and ability to work independently. Deliverables: - A fully functional API bridge as per the provided project documentation. - Documentation for the integration, including setup, configuration, and maintenance guidelines. - Any necessary adjustments to our Shopify store or WMS to support the integration. If you have the skills and experience we're looking for, please submit your proposal with examples of similar projects you've completed and your approach to this project. We're looking forward to working with an expert developer to enhance our e-commerce operations and streamline our order management process. This project is of high priority, and we are aiming for a swift and efficient execution. We understand the complexities involved in developing a custom API bridge, so it's crucial that applicants provide a realistic time estimate for completion. Please consider all aspects of the project as outlined in our requirements and your own experience with similar tasks. Your proposal should include a detailed timeline, factoring in any contingencies. Prompt delivery without compromising quality is essential, as we aim to enhance our operations and address our immediate needs.Skills: Shopify, API, HTML, API Integration, Web Development, PHP, API Development, RESTful API, JavaScript, CSS

This is the code/steps for the woocommerce solution Step 1: Add Custom Fields to WooCommerce Product Page Add the following code to your theme's functions.php file or a custom plugin. This code adds input fields for the wall width and panel selection on the product page. php add_action( 'woocommerce_before_add_to_cart_button', 'add_custom_fields_before_add_to_cart' ); function add_custom_fields_before_add_to_cart()  echo 'div class="custom-fields"'; echo 'label for="wall_width"Wall Width (cm): /label'; echo 'input type="number" id="wall_width" name="wall_width" min="1" style="margin-bottom:10px;"; echo 'label for="panel_width"Panel Width (cm): /label'; echo 'input type="number" id="panel_width" name="panel_width" min="1" style="margin-bottom:20px;"'; echo '/div'; Step 2: Enqueue JavaScript for Dynamic Progression Indicator Updates Add the following code in your functions.php to enqueue a JavaScript file. You'll need to create this JavaScript file in your theme's directory. php add_action( 'wp_enqueue_scripts', 'enqueue_custom_js' ); function enqueue_custom_js()  wp_enqueue_script( 'custom-js', get_template_directory_uri() . '/js/custom.js', array('jquery'), '', true ); wp_localize_script( 'custom-js', 'ajax_object', array( 'ajax_url' = admin_url( 'admin-ajax.php' ) ) ); // If you decide to use AJAX Create a new JavaScript file named custom.js in the js directory of your theme and add the following content: javascript jQuery(document).ready(function($)  function updateProgression()  var wallWidth = $('#wall_width').val(); var panelWidth = $('#panel_width').val(); var totalWidth = panelWidth; // Assuming one panel for simplicity. Modify as needed. var percentage = (totalWidth / wallWidth) * 100; $('.progress-bar').css('width', percentage + '%').text(Math.round(percentage) + '%');  $('#wall_width, #panel_width').change(updateProgression); ); Ensure you also add CSS for the progression bar in your theme's style.css: css .progress-container  width: 100%; background-color: #e0e0e0; margin-top: 20px;  .progress-bar  height: 20px; background-color: #4CAF50; width: 0%; text-align: center; line-height: 20px; color: white; Step 3: Add Progression Bar HTML Modify your WooCommerce product template to include the progression bar HTML. You can do this by overriding the template file or by adding the following HTML directly in the add_custom_fields_before_add_to_cart function before the closing /div: php echo 'div class="progress-container"'; echo 'div class="progress-bar"0%/div'; echo '/div'; Step 4: Save Custom Field Data (Optional) If you need to save the custom field data when a product is added to the cart, use the following hook in your functions.php: php add_filter( 'woocommerce_add_cart_item_data', 'save_custom_product_fields', 10, 2 ); function save_custom_product_fields( $cart_item_data, $product_id )  if( isset( $_POST['wall_width'] ) ) $cart_item_data['wall_width'] = $_POST['wall_width']; if( isset( $_POST['panel_width'] ) )  $cart_item_data['panel_width'] = $_POST['panel_width'];  return $cart_item_data; Skills: Shopware, API, CSS, Plugin Development, Symfony

title: Javascript- Graphics and Animation - Upwork
description: Part I Overview: In the first part of the final project, you will set up a complex scene by loading from two simple file formats—OBJ models accompanied by MTL material files. You will then apply lighting and texturing. When it is done, your scene will consist of a lit and colored car sitting on a lit and colored road next to a lit and textured stop sign, illuminated by a lit and colored streetlamp. Part 1-1: Setting your Scene The first step is to review the starter code for this project. It contains a Model and a Face class and a series of calls that take in OBJ and MTL files and parses them into Model objects. Make sure you understand what this code is doing and what it returns so that you know how to use it in your program. You are welcome (but not required) to make any modifications to this code that you see fit. If you see any errors in this starter code or have any suggestions for improvement, let the instructor know. The starter code produces several console.log() statements that allow you to look at everything that has been processed from the files. You should study these statements to understand how the data in the Model class is organized. In particular, node how Model has an array of Face instances that contain all of the vertices, normals, and texture coordinates for each face in that model. The faces have all been triangulated for you, so you can just pass them directly into the vertex shader (either one face at a time or all at once) to draw your mesh using gl.TRIANGLES. Each face also has a corresponding material field that references one of the materials in the diffuseMap and specularMap fields in Model. You can use this information to look up the appropriate values for your lighting calculations on that face. Once you are comfortable with the above information, you should then render your models in a simple view to verify that your program is working. (HINT: Start with the stop sign, since it's the simplest mesh.) You will then want to set up your scene as shown in the demo video (you will incorporate the bunny in a later step). Once everything is set up correctly, you should then turn your attention to the MTL files. Diffuse colors in the form “Kd [R] [G] [B]” Specular colors in the form “Ks [R] [G] [B]” A diffuse texture map in the form “map_Kd [Map Image]” Part 1-2: Lighting Next, you will place a point light at the top of your streetlamp to illuminate your scene. Your light should use Phong shading, and you should use the previously loaded diffuse and specular material colors from the MTL file. You may create your own ambient color. Allow the user to press the ‘L’ key to toggle the light on/off, but make sure that ambient light is still applied to your scene even when the light is off. Implementation Notes: Your lighting will likely look flat simply due to the normals on the provided models not being smoothed. Part 1-3: Texturing Next, you will implement texturing in your program using the texture coordinates loaded from the stop sign’s OBJ file, accompanied by the stop.png texture as specified in the map_Kd attribute of the material in stopsign.mtl. Implementation Notes: The texture coordinates in the OBJ file are flipped along the Y-axis; to get your final texture coordinates, you should subtract the V coordinates from 1. Part 1-4: Camera Animation Finally, you will implement basic camera animation so that the user can view your scene from different angles. When the user presses the ‘C’ key, make the camera move along a circle on the XZ plane, while bobbing up and down slightly (along the Y-axis) as shown in the demo. (HINT: Think about how you might use the trigonometric functions.) The camera should not jump at all when the user starts or stops the animation and should preserve its current state. Part II Final Project Part II DemoLinks in starter file Overview: In the second part of the final project, you will use a matrix stack to structure your scene through hierarchical transformations. You will also implement simple shadows, reflections, and refractions. Part 2-1: Hierarchical Transformations Part 2-2: Hierarchical Camera Part 2-3: Shadows Part 2-4: Skybox Part 2-5: Reflections and Refractions (i.e. Environment Maps) Make bids and I will share more details and files also in chats. Happy Bidding!!!Skills: TypeScript, JavaScript

title: DB Migration Developer (MSSQL to Postgres Migration) - Upwork
description: Mactores is looking for a highly skilled and experienced Database Developer to lead and execute the migration project from MS SQL Server to PostgreSQL. The ideal candidate will lead hands-on execution of migrating database objects such as tables, stored procedures, functions, and views from MS SQL Server to PostgreSQL. The candidate will also be responsible for migrating the SQL statements within the application code to facilitate the migration. What you will do? 1) Migrate essential database components, including but not limited to tables, stored procedures, functions, and views from MS SQL Server to PostgreSQL. 2) Validate and ensure the migrated objects function as intended in the PostgreSQL environment. 3) Evaluate existing application codebase to identify SQL statements that interact with the MS SQL Server. 4) Modify and adapt SQL statements within the application code to align with PostgreSQL syntax and functionalities. 5) Collaborate with application developers to ensure a smooth transition and troubleshoot any code-related issues post-migration. 6) Analyze and optimize database performance during and post-migration to ensure efficient query execution and system responsiveness. 7) Maintain comprehensive documentation throughout the migration process, detailing methodologies, challenges, solutions, and outcomes. What are we looking for? 1) Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as a Database Developer or Migration Specialist. 2) Proven expertise in MS SQL Server and PostgreSQL database platforms. 3) Strong understanding of database architecture, design principles, and data migration      methodologies. 4) Proficient in SQL scripting, optimization techniques, and performance tuning. 5) Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills. 6) Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and adapt to changing priorities. 7) Exceptional communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical information to diverse audiences. You will be preferred if. -If you are a Database Migration Engineer with a passion for executing complex migration projects and have a solid background in MSSQL and Postgres, we encourage you to apply and be a key contributor to the success of this migration initiative at Mactores. Life at Mactores We care about creating a culture that makes a real difference in the lives of every Mactorian. Our 10 Core Leadership Principles that honor Decision-making, Leadership, Collaboration, and Curiosity drive how we work. 1. Be one step ahead 2. Deliver the best 3. Be bold 4. Pay attention to the detail 5. Enjoy the challenge 6. Be curious and take action 7. Take leadership 8. Own it 9. Deliver value 10. Be collaborative We would like you to read more details about the work culture on https://mactores.com/careers The Path to Joining the Mactores Team At Mactores, our recruitment process is structured around three distinct stages: Pre-Employment Assessment: You will be invited to participate in a series of pre-employment evaluations to assess your technical proficiency and suitability for the role. Managerial Interview: The hiring manager will engage with you in multiple discussions, lasting anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour, to assess your technical skills, hands-on experience, leadership potential, and communication abilities. HR Discussion: During this 30-minute session, you'll have the opportunity to discuss the offer and next steps with a member of the HR team. At Mactores, we are committed to providing equal opportunities in all of our employment practices, and we do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local laws. This policy extends to all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, compensation, promotions, transfers, disciplinary action, layoff, training, and social and recreational programs. All employment decisions will be made in compliance with these principles. Note: Please answer as many questions as possible with this application to accelerate the hiring process.Skills: Data Migration, Database Optimization, Database Design, PostgreSQL, Database Administration, MySQL, Tech & IT, Database Architecture

title: Build a Client Dashboard - Upwork
description: Project Overview The goal of this project is to develop a client dashboard that enables users to create and manage projects based on different categories. The dashboard should provide a seamless experience for clients to build out project briefs, communicate with specialists, track deliverables and milestones, manage team members, and handle billing and payments. Key Features Project Creation: Users should be able to create new projects by selecting from predefined categories. Each category will have a template for the project brief that the user can fill out. Project Management: Each project should have a dedicated page that includes: Brief: A detailed brief based on the selected category. Messages: A messaging feature to communicate with assigned specialists. Deliverables: A section to track the progress of project deliverables. Milestones: A timeline or checklist to monitor project milestones. Client Dashboard: The dashboard should allow clients to: - Add and manage team members. - Update user profiles and create a team profile. - Add and manage payment methods. - View and update billing details. - Upload and manage documents related to the projects. Technical Requirements Frontend: Use a modern JavaScript framework (e.g., React, Vue.js) for a responsive and interactive UI. Backend: Consider using Node.js or Django for handling server-side logic and API endpoints. Database: Use a relational database (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) to store user and project data. Authentication: Implement secure authentication and authorization mechanisms for user accounts. Payment Integration: Integrate a payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) for handling billing and payments. File Storage: Use cloud storage (e.g., AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage) for document uploads. Development Milestones Project Setup: Set up the development environment, project structure, and database schema. User Authentication: Implement user registration, login, and profile management. Project Creation: Develop the feature for creating and categorizing projects. Project Dashboard: Build the project dashboard with brief, messages, deliverables, and milestones. Client Dashboard: Implement the client dashboard with team management, billing, and document upload features. Testing and QA: Conduct thorough testing of all features and fix any bugs or issues. Deployment: Deploy the application to a production server and perform final testing.Skills: Web Application, Full-Stack Development, Payment Gateway Integration, Chatbot, ChatGPT API Integration, Web Development

title: Build a responsive hotels and other ground products booking platform with payment functionality - Upwork
description: Seeking a talented web designer/developer with a deep understanding of hotel booking platforms' architecture and functionalities. The project entails building a responsive ground products booking platform from scratch. The platform will offer accommodations (hotels, apartments, and villas), transfers, and sightseeing services in a few countries. It will feature a channel manager, automated real-time information synchronization, and updates. If you are familiar with this industry, the platform will provide functionalities similar to well-known platforms such as Airbnb, Booking.com, Expedia, etc. This includes the generation of invoices, vouchers, email confirmations, and more. Here are the required skills below: - Full-stack Web Developer: Responsible for designing and implementing the entire online platform, including the user interface, database, and server-side logic. - Front-end Developer: Specialized in creating an intuitive and visually appealing user interface for the online booking tool, ensuring a seamless user experience. - Back-end Developer: Manages the server-side logic, databases, and ensures the smooth functioning of the booking tool, including handling complex transactions and interactions. - Mobile App Developer: Develops mobile applications for both iOS and Android platforms to extend the reach of the online booking tool. - Database Administrator: Ensures efficient and secure storage, retrieval, and management of large volumes of data related to hotel bookings, transfers, excursions, and flights. - System Integration Specialist: Integrates various modules and systems, such as hotel reservation systems, flight booking systems, and others, to ensure seamless communication and data flow. - Cybersecurity Expert: Implements robust security measures to protect customer data, payment information, and ensure overall system security. - API Developer: Builds and maintains APIs to facilitate communication between different systems, third-party services, and the online booking tool. - Data Analyst: Analyzes customer data and booking patterns to provide insights for business optimization, personalized marketing, and improved customer experiences. - Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer: Ensures the reliability, functionality, and security of the online booking tool through thorough testing and quality control. - DevOps Engineer: Automates deployment processes, monitors system performance, and ensures the continuous integration and delivery of new features and updates. - UX/UI Designer: Collaborates with developers to create a user-friendly and visually appealing interface, considering user experience at every stage of the booking process. - Customer Support Specialist: Provides technical support to users, addresses issues, and ensures a positive customer experience. - Experience with Hotel Booking Platforms: Specifically, someone who has worked with or understands the architecture of hotel booking platforms, including features like channel managers, real-time information synchronization, and automated updates. - Responsive Design Expertise: A designer/developer who can create a user-friendly and visually appealing interface that works seamlessly across various devices and screen sizes. - Channel Manager Integration: Experience in integrating a channel manager, which allows the platform to connect and synchronize with various accommodation providers, ensuring real-time availability and updates. - Automated Information Synchronization: Knowledge of automation processes to synchronize and update information in real-time, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in bookings and availability. - E-commerce and Payment Gateway Integration: Skills in integrating secure payment gateways and e-commerce functionalities for handling transactions on the platform. - Invoicing and Voucher Generation: Expertise in developing systems that can generate invoices, vouchers, and email confirmations automatically upon successful bookings. - Familiarity with Industry Standards: Understanding of industry standards and best practices related to ground product booking platforms, similar to those used by platforms like Airbnb, Booking.com, and Expedia. - Internationalization and Localization: Understanding of creating a platform that can cater to users from different countries, including language preferences, currency conversions, and regional regulations. - Project Management Skills: Effective communication and project management skills to coordinate with other team members and stakeholders throughout the development process. title: Urgent Hiring for Go(lang) Developers - Upwork

The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in Go programming and have hands-on experience in a variety of technical areas, including GRPC, stubs development, payment integration, and graph database implementation. title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience – DR127 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: API Development, API Integration, Full-Stack Development, Web Application, Website Redesign, Web Development, Website Optimization, Database Development, Desktop Application, Payment Gateway Integration, Browser Extension, Platform Plugin, WordPress Plugin

title: Developing E-Commerce Site for Cell Phone Plan Company - Upwork
description: Expert Full-Stack Developer Needed for E-Commerce Cell Service Website Description: Idaho Mobile, an emerging leader in the cell service industry, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Full-Stack Developer to build a comprehensive e-commerce website from the ground up. Our company specializes in providing top-tier data, talk, and text plans through seamless integration with major telecom APIs, including T-Mobile, to offer unparalleled service to our customers. This project demands a developer with a robust skill set in API integration and e-commerce platform development. Responsibilities: - Develop a responsive, user-friendly e-commerce website for Idaho Mobile, emphasizing a seamless shopping experience for data, talk, and text plans. - Integrate various APIs, including T-Mobile and other necessary telecom APIs, to facilitate real-time services and ensure operational excellence. - Implement a secure checkout process, including integration with payment gateways such as Stripe (or equivalents) for transaction processing. - Design and develop a robust backend infrastructure using AWS to support website functionality, including data storage, processing, and security. - Configure email and texting updates for customers using SendGrid, Twilio, or equivalent services, ensuring timely communication regarding their plans and services. Skills and Qualifications: - Proven experience in full-stack web development, with a portfolio that demonstrates expertise in building e-commerce platforms from scratch. - Strong proficiency in WooCommerce for e-commerce development, AWS for cloud services, and database management to support a scalable website architecture. - Expertise in integrating and managing APIs, particularly with telecom companies, to ensure seamless service provisioning and management. - Familiarity with payment gateway integration, such as Stripe or equivalents, for secure and efficient transaction processing. - Experience with email and SMS communication services like SendGrid and Twilio, or their equivalents, for customer engagement. - Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle challenges in integrating complex systems into a cohesive user experience. Project Duration: Upfront website budget is $3000. (Although if you can do it for less that would make us look deeper at your proposal). After the website is done, and if you did a good job. We would pay you to maintain the website going forward.   Take a look at a website template we are considering using for an idea as to the scale of this project, as you will have to build something like almost every screen in here: https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/K7135XF4XP9G#/screens/472028535 Looking to hire quickly.Skills: WooCommerce, API Integration

title: AI Driven Website - Upwork
description: The scope of building the website integrated with ChatGPT encompasses several key components. As a full stack developer, your responsibilities would include: Frontend Development: Designing and implementing the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) of the website. This involves creating responsive layouts, incorporating interactive elements, and ensuring compatibility across different devices and browsers. Backend Development: Building the server-side infrastructure to support the website's functionality. This includes setting up databases, developing APIs for data retrieval and storage, and implementing server-side logic for processing user requests. Integration with ChatGPT: Integrating the ChatGPT API into the website to enable natural language processing and interaction with users. This involves handling user inputs, sending requests to the ChatGPT API, and displaying responses in the website interface. Database Management: Creating and managing the database schema to store user data, chat logs, and other relevant information. This includes optimizing database queries for performance and scalability. Security and Authentication: Implementing security measures to protect user data and prevent unauthorized access. This includes encryption of sensitive information, implementing user authentication and authorization mechanisms, and mitigating common security threats such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS). Testing and Quality Assurance: Conducting thorough testing of the website to identify and fix any bugs or issues. This includes unit testing individual components, integration testing the website as a whole, and conducting usability testing to ensure a smooth user experience. Deployment and Maintenance: Deploying the website to a production environment and ensuring its ongoing maintenance and upkeep. This includes monitoring performance, applying updates and patches, and addressing any issues that arise post-launch. Overall, as a full stack developer, your role would involve managing the end-to-end development process of the website, from frontend design to backend implementation, integration with ChatGPT, database management, security, testing, deployment, and maintenance.Skills: Web Application, AI App Development, API Integration, Full-Stack Development, Payment Gateway Integration, OpenAI Codex Prompt, Python, Artificial Intelligence

title: Build a 2-sided Marketplace Website - Upwork

The website should include the following features: - User registration and profile creation - Search and filter options for users to find relevant listings - Listing creation and editing capabilities for both buyers and sellers - Payment gateway integration for smooth transactions - Secure data storage and retrieval - API integration for data synchronization with third-party services The ideal candidate should have the following skills: EITHER - Deep experience with the bubble.io platform OR - Proficiency in web development frameworks such as React or Angular - Experience with database management systems such as MySQL - Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript - Familiarity with API integration and RESTful APIs - Understanding of responsive design principles - Experience with version control systems such as Git The website should be designed to be responsive across different devices and should be optimized for speed and performance. The developer should be able to work independently and deliver high-quality work within the given timeline. Good communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with the team are also essential. We are looking to develop an MVP with an estimated duration of 2 - 3 weeks. The end goal is a 'good enough' platform that can be tested and shown to others, with all aspects in working order but imperfect design or flow is ok. The expertise level required for this job is intermediate. We expect the developer to have previous experience in building marketplace platforms and to be able to provide examples of previous work. The selected candidate will be expected to sign a non-disclosure agreement and adhere to our intellectual property policies.Skills: Web Design, Web Development, WordPress, JavaScript, Graphic Design

title: Cash App - Upwork
description: Job Title: Mobile App Development Technologist for a Financial Services Application (P2P Money Transfer, Money Storage, and Payments) Project Overview: We are seeking an experienced and dynamic mobile app development team to create a peer-to-peer (P2P) money transfer and payment application, tentatively named Solvent Cash. This app will enable users to store money, send and receive payments instantly, and perform P2P money transfers easily and securely. Our mission is to facilitate financial empowerment and inclusivity, targeting underserved communities with limited access to traditional banking services. Deliverables: - A fully functional mobile application for iOS and Android platforms, including: - User registration and authentication system - Bank account and credit/debit card integration - A digital wallet for money storage - P2P money transfer functionality - Payment request and split bill features - Transaction history and notifications - A user-friendly, intuitive UI/UX design - A backend system for managing transactions, user data, and security - Compliance with all relevant financial regulations and data protection laws - A web-based admin dashboard for managing app users, viewing transaction data, and generating reports - Integration with third-party services for KYC verification, fraud detection, and payment processing - Deployment of the app on App Store and Google Play, including passing all necessary reviews Skills Required: - Proficiency in mobile app development languages and frameworks (Swift/Kotlin for native apps; Flutter/React Native for cross-platform development) - Experience with backend development (Node.js, Python, Ruby, Java, or Go) and database management (SQL and NoSQL databases) - Familiarity with financial APIs and payment gateway integration (Stripe, PayPal, Square) - Strong understanding of security practices, encryption, and compliance (KYC, AML regulations) - Expertise in UI/UX design for mobile applications, focusing on ease of use and accessibility - Experience in deploying and maintaining apps on both iOS and Android platforms - Excellent problem-solving skills and familiarity with agile development methodologies Communication: - Weekly video calls for progress updates, discussions, and planning - Daily written updates via UpWork messages or preferred project management tools (e.g., Slack, Trello) - Open and transparent communication is crucial; we value feedback and encourage questions and suggestions at any stage of the project Working with Us: - We believe in a collaborative approach, where your insights and expertise are valued and considered in decision-making processes. - We are committed to creating a supportive environment, respecting time zones, and work-life balance. - We appreciate proactive communication and the ability to adapt to changes as the project evolves. - Our team values diversity, inclusivity, and creativity, and we look forward to working with individuals who share these principles. Application Requirements: - Portfolio of previous work, specifically highlighting any financial service apps or projects with similar complexity. - References or testimonials from past clients. - A brief proposal outlining your approach to the project, including a tentative timeline and budget estimate. - Availability for a preliminary video call to discuss the project details and ensure alignment of expectations. Conclusion: We are excited to find the right development technologist to bring this project to life. This project offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on financial inclusivity, providing essential services to those traditionally underserved by the banking sector. If you are passionate about leveraging technology for social good and have the skills listed above, we encourage you to apply.Skills: iOS, Android, Mobile App Development, User Authentication, Payment Functionality, Social Media Account Integration, React Native, User Profile Creation, Android App Development, iOS Development

title: Develop an Interactive Website with LLM Integration - Upwork
description: Project Overview: We are seeking a skilled freelancer to develop a dynamic website comprising four main pages (Homepage, Featured Insights, Contact Us, Registered User Space) and several temporary pages (e.g., Registration, Payment). The website will integrate a LLM (Large Language Model) for interactive user engagement, backed by a back-end system including a registered user database and document database on a VPS (that the LLM needs to read). Front-End Requirements: - Homepage: Must feature a navigation bar with multilanguage plugin, a prominent chat window for LLM interactions with history and hint questions (similar to ChatGPT), a topic selection dropdown, and a section for featured articles. - Featured Insights: A layout supporting unlimited paging for articles, each with a standard format. - Contact Us: A standard contact form linked to an email address. Registered User Space: Displays user details (username, first name, last name, email), subscription status, referral link and bonus, - Temporary Pages: Including user registration with validation checks, category selection for free or premium users, and a secure payment gateway. Back-End Requirements: - User Database: To manage user profiles, validate emails, handle payments via PayPal, and track user activity. - Document Database: Storage for PDF and Word documents accessible by the LLM. - LLM Integration: Flexible in open or closed-source options, capable of processing large quantity of documents (more than thousands for pdf and word documents) in multiple languages, and providing tiered user access to information. Additional Specifications: - WordPress: Preferred for ease of future content updates by the project owner. - Python: Required for back-end development. - Global Access: The solution must be accessible globally, including regions with restrictions on some closed source LLMs such as ChatGPT. - Delivery and Training: Complete handover of deliverables with training for the project owner on deployment and minor code adjustments. - Intellectual Property: All developed codes will be the sole property of the project owner. Project Deliverables: - A fully functional, multilingual website as per the described specifications. - Complete back-end setup with LLM integration, user and document databases. - Documentation and training for the project owner on system management and updates. - We are looking for a freelancer who can deliver this project efficiently while ensuring high quality and compliance with the outlined requirements. Please include examples of similar projects you've completed and propose your approach, particularly regarding LLM integration.Skills: WordPress, Python, Web Development, Large Language Model

title: freelancer services system powered by SMS - Upwork
description: Building a freelancer services system powered by SMS User Registration and Authentication: Client registration with unique client ID Freelancer registration with unique freelancer ID Two-factor authentication (2FA) for user verification Job Request Management: Client sends job requests via SMS Job request parsing and extraction of relevant information (e.g., job title, description, skills required, budget, deadline) Storage of job requests in the database Freelancer Search and Matching: Database of registered freelancers with unique freelancer IDs Matching algorithm to find qualified freelancers based on job requirements Forward job requests to matched freelancers via SMS Proposal Submission: Freelancers submit proposals via SMS, including details like price, deadline, and additional information Storage of proposals in the database Client Approval and Selection: Client reviews proposals received from freelancers Client approves a proposal via SMS, including the selected freelancer ID Communication and Messaging: SMS gateway integration for sending and receiving SMS messages SMS notifications for job requests, proposal submissions, and approvals SMS-based communication between clients and freelancers Rating and Review System: Clients provide ratings and reviews for freelancers after project completion Display freelancer ratings and reviews for clients to make informed decisions System Administration: Admin dashboard to manage users, job requests, proposals, and payments User management, including account verification, suspension, or termination Security and Privacy: Implementation of security measures to protect user data Confidentiality through non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) and masked phone numbers Compliance with data privacy regulations Logging and Analytics: Logging of system activities, SMS communications, and user interactions Analytics and reporting to track system performance and user behavior Error Handling and Exception Management: Proper handling of errors, exceptions, and edge cases throughout the system Robust error logging and reporting mechanisms Freelancer Profile: Enhance the freelancer profile section to include a field for an automated signature. Allow freelancers to set and update their signature within their profile settings. Proposal Submission Process: When a freelancer replies with a proposal via SMS, append their automated signature to the proposal message. Retrieve the freelancer's signature from their profile and append it to the proposal text. Formatting and Display: Format the proposal message to include the freelancer's signature in a clear and visually distinguishable way. Consider adding separators or specific formatting to differentiate the proposal content from the signature. Signature Customization: Provide freelancers with the option to customize their signature, such as adding their name, contact information, or a tagline. Define any limitations or guidelines for the signature, such as character limits or prohibited content. Signature Management: Include functionality for freelancers to update or modify their signature within their profile settings. Ensure that any changes to the signature are immediately reflected in the proposals they send.Skills: Database, Python Script, API, Python, SQLite

title: Looking to interview Indigenous people of Canada (Quebec if possible) for cultural accuracy in book - Upwork
description: I have no idea if I'll be able to find the right person on here, so here goes! I'm currently outlining a contemporary romance book whose male love interest is an Indigenous man living in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec, Canada. To accurately represent this character, I'm doing some research on what the true lived experience for this type of character could look and feel like. Specifically, I'm looking for insights on what it's like to grow up in a small town which tend to be predominantly white. Even more specifically, this small town is located in the Eastern Townships of Quebec. While there are three Mohawk reservations nearby (Akwesasne, Kahnawake, and Kanesatake), they're all quite far from the Eastern townships, which means that even a Mohawk character would be quite isolated from his community. The parents of this character have raised him in this town due to their jobs as zoologists, and since the biggest zoo in the province is in Granby, they had to live nearby. I'm looking to: -Accurately describe the relationship between this man and his culture, as well as the dynamics he had to exist within away from his community -Get a fully fleshed-out character -Portray this character with respect and sensitivity With this in mind, I'm looking to speak to people of Canadian Indigenous communities - even better if you belong to a community located somewhere in the province of Quebec, such as the Cree or Mohawk people. The role will entail conversations over text directly on the Upwork platform - no phone/video interviews necessary. I had a Mohawk character in mind. With that being said, I only want to write about a character if I can accurately and respectfully represent them. This means I am open to hearing from other cultures and changing the character. I am still VERY early in the outlining process and his personality/charachter arc has not been developed yet. If you think your lived experience fits what I'm looking for, please apply! To apply, please share a bit of information about what perspective you can give me. At this time, I am only interested in speaking to people who belong to Indigenous communities of Canada directly, so please do not apply if you do not belong to these communities, even if you have a degree in Indigenous studies. It is very important for me to get first-hand perspectives throughout this research process.Skills: English

title: Amazon seller account deactivated 3 of Amazon Business Solutions Agreement. - Upwork
description: Hello, I wish you a nice day. I received a message from amazon on 02/21/2024 saying "Hello, Your Amazon Seller account was deactivated under Section 3 of the Amazon Services Business Solutions Agreement and the Unsuitable Inventory Investigations Policy. During this time, you may be unable to create removal orders for your inventory present in Amazon Fulfillment Centers, and funds will not be transferred to you but will stay in your account while we work with you to address this issue in accordance with our Funds Withholding. Policy: https://sellercentral.amazon.com/gp/help/external/help.html?itemID=9RA9LYBJ3QP27M6 Shipment ID under review: A message saying "FBA17BSX2TQD" was received. There were 1 ASIN 66 products in this reviewed Shipment ID. I bought this product in August and sold it. This product was not in my inventory or list. ASIN in the box: B00004RFS8 . I bought this product from buy bulk amarica wholesaler. I uploaded the invoice to the system and a few days later I received an e-mail from Amazon as follows. ''Hello Seller, We received your submission but do not have enough information to reactivate your account at this time. To reactivate your account, please submit the following documentation to support the inventory present in your Amazon store. * Supply chain documentation, such as invoices or receipts, for the inventory that you have listed on your account. This is required to verify ownership of the products present in your Amazon store. Documentation must include:     * Supplier information such as name, phone number, address, or website, item descriptions. For ease of review, you may highlight or circle the ASIN(s) under review.     * Item quantities (you may remove pricing information) but the rest of the document must be visible.     * Note: Highlighted/circled ASIN(s) or removal of pricing information will not be considered altered. * Import or export documents (if applicable), bills of lading, commercial invoices, and packing lists. * Letter of Authorization from the brand owner, Brand letters authorizing your use of trademark, design, patent, or copyright. * Document supporting supplier authorized by the brand owner * Licensing agreement * Order confirmation receipts if the item is purchased online           You should only send .pdf, .jpg, .png, or .gif files. These documents must be authentic and unlocked. ASIN(s) under review: B0018KJ1YW B01B21JM7M B07PQSYKR1 B000BQWH40 '' I uploaded the invoices, delivery documents and payment documents of these asins they told me to the system, but I still have not received a response. I bought these products from wholesalers named kaywholesale, Sn internatioal and ecom wholesale deals. I would be glad if you help me in this regard. Hello, after sending you an e-mail, I received such a response from the invoices I sent to Amazon. What are your opinions on this subject? Can you solve this problem? I would really appreciate if you can help. What kind of plan should we proceed with? '' Hello Seller, We received your submission but we are unable to reactivate your account. Upon review of your account, we observed that you have supplied documentation to Amazon which were from an un-verifiable supplier. Additionally, the impacted inventory that is listed at the end of the notification may be disposed in accordance with the "Unsuitable Inventory Investigations Policy".  Our policy can be found here: https://sellercentral.amazon.com/help/hub/reference/GH4YYXNDRW9BSZEN. Why is this happening? Your Amazon seller account has been deactivated in accordance with section 3 of Amazon Business Solutions Agreement. You can also visit the "Selling Policies and Seller Code of Conduct" Amazon policy: https://sellercentral.amazon.com/gp/help/G1801 Thank you, Amazon '' Thank you Ethem A. title: Setup a Docker based reverse proxy+WAF+ssl with 3 CMS containers - Upwork
description: Hi, let me start by saying - please completely disregard the listed budget - I only put it because upwork will not let me list the job as a fixed budget without a figure. Set your price what you thing the job is worth. Now the job: Hello, I have a web server that keeps getting infected by warms... its on Apache with php,mysql on Debian. No matter what I do viruses keep infecting neighboring sites (vhosts) and things at this point are beyond repair. So I've been advised to go the docker way with a reverse proxy with WAF in front the website containers and it sounds promising. Important: I do not want the job just done once but to know how to set it up myself in case everything goes south... If I have to summarize - I need a step by step tutorial how to turn brand new Ubuntu server into this (as follows): 1 Docker container - proxy (nginx) + waf like in this tutorial (https://medium.com/cloud-native-daily/dockerized-mod-security-waf-c3e7233be002) + Certbot or other auto ssl solution with cronjob. 3 more containers as follows 1 wordpress (latest) 1 joomla (latest) 1 drupal (latest) - Static IP's on the containers - Php on each container to be at least 8.0 - Bash on every container - SSH with unique port on the host machine forwarding to each container, - Phpmyadmin on every container, - Files from each container's www directory have to be mapped to a host machine folder in order to be preserved in the case of rebuilding the container. - here I have a little dejavu with the cross-contamination of my current setup, so if not a good idea to pup files from different sites close to eachother, then we can skip this setup and I'll think of a regular file backup - This would be nice as well: http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_limit_req_module.html If you have any suggestions to better the idea explained in the beginning - please do so. I may have asked stupid stuff above as I am new to how Docker works and what can or can not be done... so please feel free to correct me so the job requirement becomes more clear. I just want to have a working set of web servers in separate container behind reverse proxy+WAF+ssl to avoid breaching or cross-contamination in the event of a breach. I hope all this makes sense. I really need to hear your thought on this first. I highly doubt that I managed to cover all aspects of what needs to be done to achieve a semi-secure web server setup with my limited skills. ThanksSkills: Linux System Administration, NGINX, Docker

title: European based Executive Assistant - Upwork
description: Job Title: Virtual Executive Assistant Job Summary: We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Executive Assistant to provide comprehensive administrative support to our executives in a remote work environment. The ideal candidate should excel in multitasking, possess excellent communication skills, and be adept at handling various tasks with efficiency. This role requires a high level of discretion, professionalism, and the ability to work independently to meet deadlines. Responsibilities:  The individual must be proactive in familiarising themselves with the ecosystem of the company and its related companies, and the individuals connected.  Calendar Management: Schedule and coordinate appointments, meetings, and conference calls for executives, ensuring optimal use of their time considering timezone differences..  Email Correspondence: Manage and prioritize emails, responding on behalf of executives when necessary, and maintaining a well-organized inbox.  Noting in emails deadlines that have been set by the executives and following up leading up to those deadlines on important tasks.  Travel Arrangements: Coordinate domestic and international travel, including flight bookings, hotel accommodations, and transportation arrangements, considering time zones and potential changes.  Document Preparation: Draft, edit, and proofread documents, presentations, and reports as needed, maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.  Communication Liaison: Serve as a point of contact between executives and internal/external stakeholders, handling inquiries and providing timely responses.  Meeting Coordination: Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and ensure follow-up on action items, fostering effective communication within the team.  Expense Management: Track and reconcile expenses, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies.  Research and Information Gathering: Conduct research on various topics, compile data, and present findings to support decision-making processes.  Task Prioritization: Assess and prioritize tasks to ensure that urgent matters are addressed promptly, and important deadlines are met.  Virtual Office Organization: Establish and maintain organized virtual workspaces, ensuring accessibility of relevant documents and information.  Confidentiality: Handle sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality and discretion. Requirements:  Proven Experience: Previous experience as an executive assistant or in a similar role, preferably in a virtual or remote setting.  Technological Proficiency: Proficient in using virtual collaboration tools, such as video conferencing, project management software, and cloud-based document sharing and docusign software..  Creative Skills: Not an urgent requirement but it will be useful for the candidate to have basic creative skills and be able to use software such as canva.  Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen ability to communicate professionally and diplomatically.  Time Management: Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently. There may be the need to attend to an urgent matter outside of the normal working hours therefore the individual must be able to be flexible with this where required.  Problem-Solving Skills: Resourceful and proactive in addressing challenges, demonstrating the ability to think critically and provide solutions.  Adaptability: Comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, adjusting to changing priorities and deadlines.  Tech-savvy: Comfortable using a variety of software and applications for communication, scheduling, and document management.  Degree: A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is preferred. Join our team as a Virtual Executive Assistant and play a crucial role in supporting our executives and contributing to the overall success of our organization.Skills: Communications, Personal Administration, Executive Support, Administrative Support, Email Communication, Virtual Assistance

title: Google Sheet & Workspace Setup - Upwork
description: Custom Expense Tracking System For Construction Company We have a system for our construction company that outputs expenses to a CSV file. The file contains all of the pertinent info that we need (transaction date, vendor, cost code, job name etc) along with a number of columns we don't need, which presumably we can hide or ignore. We would like to implement a system in which we upload the data weekly and it is then tabulated in a master sheet and formatted correctly. We would then like to have expense info for specific jobs automatically sent to separate spreadsheets that contain only the data for that job. We would like to create a similar functioning table for Labor hours, which are also coded to each job. Once the data is forwarded into the specific job table, we would then like to categorize and subtotal the transactions by cost code (ie, all of the expenses coded as PLUMBING will be grouped together, sorted by date, and subtotaled as a total PLUMBING expense). I have examples of how we have done most of this in Apple Numbers but am looking for help simplifying and automating the process so when we begin having an office admin enter the expense and payroll data, the process is automated and minimizes opportunity for error.  I have attached samples of the unsorted, but cleaned up data from our expense tracking system and have also included a sample invoice that we are attempting to mimic. Thanks for taking the time to read this post. If you feel you are qualified to take this project on please reference "Project Ellie Mae" in your response. Thanks, DanSkills: Google Apps Script, Google Sheets Automation, Dashboard, Google Sheets, Scripting, Automation, API, Looker Studio, Google Forms, Google Docs, VLOOKUP, Macros, Analytics Dashboard, Email Automation, Automated Workflow

title: Build Vision Pro app for Mission Control like features - Upwork
description: Develop a Workspace Management App with Hand Gesture Control for Vision Pro Device Job Description: We are looking for a talented app developer to create an innovative workspace management application specifically designed for Apple's Vision Pro. This application aims to mimic and enhance the functionality of Mission Control found on macOS, offering users the ability to create, manage, and seamlessly switch between multiple virtual workspaces using a hand gesture. Project Objectives: Customizable Workspaces: Enable users to create multiple virtual workspaces where they can organize and place apps according to their preferences and workflow requirements. Hand Gesture Navigation: Integrate hand gesture recognition to allow users to swipe between these workspaces effortlessly. User-Friendly Interface: Design a simple and intuitive user interface that guides users in managing their applications across different workspaces. The app should prioritize ease of use and efficiency, allowing for a smooth and enjoyable user experience. Optimized for Vision Pro: Ensure the app is fully compatible and optimized for the Vision Pro device, taking advantage of its unique hardware and software capabilities to provide a seamless and responsive user experience. Required Skills: Must have created a Vision Pro app and understand the requirements but more importantly limitations of the Vision Pro. We will need your preliminary validation as to whether this app can be built or if there are too many limitations on the current VisionOS. Project Deliverables: A fully functional workspace management app tailored for the Vision Pro device, incorporating the described features.Skills: Virtual Reality, Apple Xcode, Swift

title: Executive Assistant for an ADHD Entrepreneur Working in Marketing, E-commerce, and Ministry - Upwork
description: OVERVIEW: Are you highly organized, detail-oriented, and adept at multitasking? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments and excel at providing support to busy professionals? If so, we're looking for an Executive Assistant to join our team and provide personalized assistance to an individual with ADHD. RESPONSIBILITIES: Email Management: Monitor and prioritize emails, flagging important messages for immediate attention and categorizing others for later follow-up. Draft responses to emails when appropriate and ensure timely communication. Calendar Management: Assist in scheduling appointments, meetings, and events, optimizing the individual's calendar for maximum efficiency. Send reminders and notifications for upcoming commitments to help the individual stay on track. Billing and Invoicing: Manage billing processes, including generating invoices, tracking payments, and following up on outstanding balances. Maintain accurate records of financial transactions and expenses. Organization and General Assistance: Provide general assistance in organizing workspaces, files, and documents to streamline workflow and enhance productivity. Help prioritize tasks and projects based on importance and urgency. Bookkeeping and Financial Management: Assist in paying bills, managing expenses, and reconciling accounts to ensure financial stability. Support in basic bookkeeping tasks and record-keeping. Data Entry and Spreadsheets: Perform data entry tasks and maintain spreadsheets to track various metrics, expenses, and other relevant information. Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular updates and validation. Work Systematization: Collaborate with the individual to develop and implement systems and processes to streamline workflow and increase efficiency. Assist in documenting procedures and creating templates for recurring tasks. Requirements: Proven experience as an executive assistant or similar role, preferably working with individuals with ADHD or in fast-paced environments. Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in email management tools, calendar applications, and productivity software. Experience with billing, invoicing, bookkeeping, and financial management. Ability to prioritize tasks effectively and manage time efficiently. Comfortable with data entry, spreadsheets, and basic administrative tasks. Understanding of ADHD and willingness to adapt support strategies accordingly. Part-time Trial Period: We are open to a trial period of 5-10 hours per week to assess compatibility and effectiveness. If you're passionate about providing personalized support and helping individuals succeed in their endeavors, we'd love to hear from you! How to Apply: If you're interested in this opportunity and believe you have the skills and experience to excel as an Executive Assistant, please submit your application detailing your relevant experience, availability, and why you're a good fit for the role. Additionally, include any accommodations or strategies you can offer to support someone with ADHD effectively. We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team!Skills: Bookkeeping, Business Report, Corporate Event Planning, Draft Correspondence, Travel Planning, Scheduling, Providing Information to Callers, Task Coordination, Administrative Support, Email Communication

title: Expert AWS WorkSpaces Setup & Configuration Specialist - Upwork
description: Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced AWS WorkSpaces specialist to set up and configure AWS WorkSpaces for our startup. Our goal is to deploy virtual desktops running Windows 11 with Microsoft Office applications installed for our four-member remote team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with AWS, specifically AWS WorkSpaces, and a strong background in Windows environments, including the deployment and management of Microsoft Office applications in a virtualized setting. Responsibilities: + Set up and configure AWS WorkSpaces according to best practices, ensuring a secure, scalable, and cost-effective deployment. + Install and configure Windows 11 on AWS WorkSpaces, including all necessary drivers and updates to ensure optimal performance. + Install, configure, and test Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) on all WorkSpaces, ensuring they are ready for the team's use. + Implement security measures, including configuring firewalls, managing user access controls, and ensuring data protection and compliance with relevant regulations. + Provide detailed documentation on the setup process, configurations made, and instructions for users to access and use their WorkSpaces effectively. + Offer training and support to the team for transitioning to and effectively using AWS WorkSpaces. + Troubleshoot any issues that arise during setup or initial use, providing timely and effective solutions. Requirements: + Proven experience in setting up and managing AWS WorkSpaces, with a portfolio or case studies demonstrating past projects. + Strong knowledge of Windows 11 deployment and configuration, especially in a virtualized environment. + Experience in installing and managing Microsoft Office applications in a cloud or virtualized setting. + Familiarity with AWS security practices and compliance standards. + Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues. + Strong communication skills, with the ability to provide clear instructions and documentation. + Availability for a kickoff meeting and regular check-ins throughout the project to ensure alignment with project goals. Project Duration: Please provide an estimated timeline for the setup and configuration process in your proposal. Budget: Fixed-price or hourly rate proposals are welcome. Please include your rate along with an estimated total cost for the project in your proposal. How to Apply: Submit a proposal outlining your experience with AWS WorkSpaces and Windows 11. Include a brief description of how you plan to approach this project, including any specific tools or methodologies you will use. Provide examples of similar projects you have completed, especially those involving AWS WorkSpaces and Microsoft Office. Include your availability for a kickoff meeting and estimated timelines for project completion.Skills: Amazon Web Services, System Administration, DevOps, Network Security, Network Administration, Deployment Automation

title: Email Deliverability Expert to Fix Google Workspace Emails Not Being Received by Office 365 Users - Upwork
description: Hello, We've been experiencing some email delivery issues with our Google Workspace email server. All emails that are sent from our domain to users who have corporate Office 365 are sent directly to spam. One email on our server, in particular, doesn't even get to spam - it simply does not get delivered and we receive no notification as to why. Our domain reputation is good, we've never participated in spam, our DNS records are set up correctly, including DMARC, SPF and DKIM. We have no idea what caused it and we can't see what's preventing it from being delivered. We need an expert to get to the bottom of the issue and offer a fix to the problem. Skills: Email Deliverability, Email Support, Email Communication, DNS, Office 365, System Administration

title: Market Research HealthCare - Upwork
description: Job Posting: Market Research Analyst for AI Medical Imaging Company Position Overview: We are a leading AI medical imaging company specializing in radiology solutions, seeking a highly skilled Market Research Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in identifying competitive opportunities within specific equipment modalities (MRI, CAT Scan, X-Ray) by analyzing market gaps, evaluating the total addressable market, and determining the best conditions to classify for our innovative products. Key Responsibilities: Conduct comprehensive market research to identify and evaluate competitors within the AI medical imaging radiology sector, focusing on MRI, CAT Scan, and X-Ray modalities. Analyze market trends, gaps, and opportunities to recommend the most promising conditions for classification based on various factors, including technological advancements, regulatory environment, and healthcare needs. Assess the total addressable market (TAM) for potential product offerings, considering current market penetration and future growth prospects. Collaborate with product development and marketing teams to align research findings with business strategies, ensuring our solutions meet market demands and stay ahead of competition. Present findings and strategic recommendations to senior management, supporting decision-making processes with data-driven insights.Skills: New Product Innovation, Report Writing, Market Analysis, Marketing Strategy, Qualitative Research, Competitive Analysis, Market Research

title: CRM Program for Veterinary Clinic - Upwork
description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create a custom CRM program specifically designed for managing a veterinary clinic. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development and experience working with CRM systems. This program should include features such as appointment scheduling, patient records management, billing and invoicing, inventory management, and reporting. The developer will be responsible for designing and implementing the program, as well as providing ongoing support and maintenance. Strong communication skills and the ability to understand the unique requirements of a veterinary clinic are essential for this project. Relevant Skills: - Software Development - CRM Systems - Appointment Scheduling - Patient Records Management -diagnisis & LAB and  X-ray controling and report - Billing and Invoicing - Inventory Management -medical pharmicy control - ReportingSkills: Graphic Design, Data Entry, Customer Relationship Management, PHP, Sales
